Reviews.Title: “Well connected hotel, some issues to sort out”
Reviews.Author: MohanKr
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located right next to the Gare de Lyon station, which is one of the main connecting stations for Paris. Full marks on that. The area is quite busy, as you'd expect--but the hotel is situated in a somewhat quiet corner--and that was indeed a pleasant surprise.The rooms are spacious (which is a treat in Paris, also a tad expensive) and in particular, the housekeeping and the concierge are very helpful. The gym located right in the centre of the hotel was, also, I thought a good idea. But I needed to check out a bit early in the morning at about 6.30 a.m. to catch a connecting Air France coach to CDG airport --which stops very close to the hotel, too. I was told the previous evening that I could ask for a parcelled breakfast to be provided. I did call up both reception and the breakfast guys to make my request. All seemed fine till the next morning--when during check-out I was told that all they could provide me was some coffee & biscuits. Breakfast started at 6.30 a.m., so it should not have been too much trouble ( given my request the evening before) to provide me something a bit more. The staff speak good English, so communicating is not a problem either and most of the front office staff are helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Falsely advertised - no air con”
Reviews.Author: lynda82012
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 3 night stay at the above hotel in March 2012. It was an unusually hot period of weather and on reaching the hotel lobby we were overcome by how warm it was inside - but were impressed by the lobby area. The first part of our problems was at check in. We arrived shortly after noon. We were advised that the room was in the process of being cleaned and would be available in 30 minutes. Since we didn't deem that too much of an issue we waited as we wanted to get changed etc (we were impressed with the 2 free Macs on offer to surf the web during this time). The internet was free but you had to log in every 20 minutes to release some more time. We used 2 lots of 20 minutes and went to check back in. We were advised that the room was ready but needed to be checked. We were told that would take 5 minutes and he would come back to us. After waiting another 15 minutes we went back and were told the staff still had not checked the room and there were a few frantic phone calls to the chambermaids. We were finally checked in 1hr and 20 minutes after arriving! No drinks etc were offered. Had they told us it was going to take that long we would have left our bags and not wasted our time. We were not impressed by this service and nor the heat of the bedroom (4th floor) on arrival. We quickly changed, turned the "air con" on and closed the curtains to deflect the sunlight. On our return at ~ 11pm the room was unbearably hot. Due to the long day of travelling we went to bed but had to open the window to Paris' noise. The bed had a thick duvet on too. The "air con" was non existent. On Sunday we had room service which we couldn't fault (although it was just cereal, yoghurt and croissants + drink, no option for cooked breakfast or preference to cereal / yoghurt flavours). On leaving the hotel that morning we complained about the air con to the front desk. They advised that they had no air-con! When we said it was on their website (and is still on their website) they said we were mistaken. They do not have air con. They advised that a fan would be delivered and I asked for thinner bed sheets. On our return that evening we noticed they had shut the window in the room but had supplied a fan that was very ineffective (the temperature in the room was in excessive of 20 degrees even in the evening). The "bed sheet" supplied was a blue fleece blanket that still had 4 safety pins in it from housekeeping and did not fit the kingsize bed. On Monday we were out to Disneyland and went down for breakfast at ~8am. We were shown to a table, and on getting up to get provisions, someone else was shown to "our" table. I then asked for another and was directed to another table - on getting there I noticed a pair of glasses so someone else was sitting there. On going back to the waitress we were shown our 3rd table, but again whilst we were up another couple were sat there. In the end we picked a random table as we had nothing to leave behind on the table to acknowledge we were sat there. Why this 4* hotel does not use a "reserved" tab or another means of allocating tables is beyond me. We also had to ask for coffee which took 10 minutes to arrive. We were severely displeased with this service and would not recommend the hotel breakfast. I reported the continuing issue of the hotel temperature quickly before leaving Monday morning and was told that there was nothing more they could do. We arrived back Monday evening approx. midnight and thankfully the room temperature was slightly better - this was down to the weather and nothing to do with the hotel services. Tuesday morning we booked breakfast for the room due to the problems experienced the day before. This breakfast was not to the same standards as Sunday - the mixed fruit selection was only pineapple and fewer croissants. We checked out Tuesday - and it was rather business like. There was no personal touch asking about our stay, it was simply "have you used the mini-bar" and "goodbye". For a 4* hotel I would have expected so much better. The room was rather tired looking (I believe other rooms were renovated from other reviews), no air con, 1 hour 20 mins to check in (when other guests were checking in fine) and also on 3 occasions we saw staff smoking right outside the main entrance - certainly not a nice look, especially when 1 was a chef in his whites. Overall very poor. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone going in warmer months. Why they advertise air-con and not supply it is false advertising and there was no customer service from staff. It certainly is not 4* and definitely not worth the advertised price. The TV supplied was ~ 20 inch and only had BBC World and CNN English channels. Again not what I would have expected for a 4* as we have experienced better in Europe but thats a side as the TV was only on first and last thing of the day. It is however very convenient for Gare de Lyon and Notre Dame areas.

Reviews.Title: “Best & Perfect Hotel in Paris for its exceptional customer service, excellent location & great quality versus price!”
Reviews.Author: NACH112
Reviews.Content: Hi everyone, I stayed at this great hotel in Room 209 with my wife & 12 year-old daughter from 4 till 15 March 2012 & we truly want to thank all the great staff of Novotel Gare de Lyon for making our stay a very enjoyable & truly satisfactory experience indeed. First, the Hotel has a very classy & nice historical look from the outside as well as a very modern & beautiful look from the inside & is ideally located very close to Gare De Lyon, which has endless metros & RER’s & TGV’s (Including line 1 of the Champs Elysees & RER A of Galeries Lafayette & Printemps) that can take you anywhere in Paris & in France & beyond. Second, it is the closest hotel you can get to the Air France Shuttle Bus; especially since most taxis refuse to take you for a ride if your hotel is not far, even if you have 4 bags!!! Third, all the well-trained & highly professional staff truly go beyond your regular expectations in terms of customer satisfaction; which reminded me of the great customer service of highly reputable hotels in the U.S. Fourth, the check-in was very smooth & they have 4 speedy & modern lifts, which means no waiting for elevators to reach your room, which you will find extremely modern (with safe & hairdryer & free coffee & tea facilities) & big compared to other European Hotels, who even charge much more for their rooms! Plus, the great thing is that the bathroom had both a bath tub as well as another shower tub; in addition to a seperate toilet! Fifth, the free in-door heated swimming pool was great; especially after a long day of endless walking & stair-climbing in Paris & the great thing is that it was always clean & the Hotel even provides you with towels & lockers, which only costs you 50 centimes or half a Euro, & which you even get back once you re-open your locker :) Six, the open-buffet breakfast was great & very delicious; especially the fresh omelets & mushrooms as well as the delightful "pain au chocolats" & various delicious cakes & fresh fruits. Also the experienced lady that draws on faces of children as well as the experienced balloon-man who makes you any form of balloon imaginable were both an added bonus to the breakfast. However, I would have surely preferred if the breakfast during weekdays can still be served until 10 am like in weekends as opposed to 9:30 am; especially that we all like to wake up late during our holidays! Anyway, the good thing is that Continental Breakfast can be ordered to your room in case you wake up late! Here I want to especially thank the waiter who brought, especially for us, a tray of fresh omelets & “pain au chocolats;” since, we came one day later than 9:30 & that was before we knew about the breakfast hours! This is surely customer service at its best :)) Seven, we highly appreciated the fact that my 12 year old daughter’s stay & breakfast was totally free; which is awesome; since, most other hotels in Paris, which I have checked (including Mercure & Ibis) start charging children whose age is older than 11 years old!! Eight, I read some reviews, which stated that the room is hot! Well, I found that it was warm rather than hot & which is great; since, it was very cold outside! Moreover, I advise them to do like I did & which is to kindly ask the reception or Housekeeping to provide them with thin covers rather than the double one, which is usually available. As for the beds, they are very soft & extremely comfortable :) Nine, I read from other reviews that the hotel takes a charge for the adapters (20 Euros added to the bill): Well here I just want to say that it is totally refundable upon checking-out when you return the adapter of your iPhone or iPad charger for example, like I did! Ten, we highly appreciated the fact the WiFi inside the room as well as in the lobby were totally free. In addition to 2 iMac’s in the lobby, which were also free :) Finally, we would like to truly thank the great Hotel Manager as well as all the great staff of this wonderful hotel for making our trip exceptional & highly enjoyable, & we want to specifically thank Mrs. Fares, who personally phoned us several times during our stay to make sure that everything went well & also visited our room to inform us how to reach the Police Station, after my wallet was stolen from the metro & Thank God that the French Police, which I truly thank very much, were able after only 1/2 an hour to capture the thieves & return my wallet! Thanks again to Novotel Gare de Lyon & to the excellent comments of the readers of Trip Advisor, which encouraged me to stay in this hotel in the first place (I also advise the readers to book directly through the hotel website since you get the best deal!). We will surely stay at this special Hotel every single year & maybe more than once a year; especially that you can never find in the wonderful city of Paris, all these great amenities & great customer service & excellent location with such a great & affordable price :) Best Regards, From a loving family who adores Paris :)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, avoid restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Fifi7700
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the February half term break with our two young children. The location was great and the hotel was good apart from boiling hot rooms, even with the air conditioning turned off. We ate lunch in the restaurant when we arrived on the first day, and would not recommend it - the vegetables were old and my partner's entrecote was chewy and very badly cooked. He mentioned it to three serving staff and nothing was done about it. One of them told the manager and he pretended not to know anything about it. It really felt like they did not care less about the customer's experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Eurostar connections”
Reviews.Author: Kimbo_Trader
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after catching the Eurostar from London and needing to wait for a connecting train to the south of France overnight. The hotel is literally in the precincts of the train station which was very handy and the main reason I give it 3 stars. We fitted four in a room (two little ones!) comfortably. The bed was comfortable and the room quiet. Dinner was in the hotel restaurant and was fine, though a little expensive for what it was. Breakfast was at 5 am and consisted of a packet of biscuits and some coffee though I imagine a better breakfast occurs later. I don't think I would stay here if I was holidaying in Paris as the lobby felt quite insecure with different types of people drifting in from the train station, not all of whom seemed to be hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - service could improve”
Reviews.Author: Bernoulli77
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for a weekend with my family in Paris. For an arrival at Gare de Lyon, this hotel is just perfect. Also for visiting the city it is perfect: you have Metro and RER station just around the corner that takes you to the city center in less than 15 min. The hotel lobby, looks very impressing with the exposed concrete surfaces, the rooms are very clean and absolutely modern! The bathroom was the most modern I´ve seen so far. It had the funny feature of a glass wall separating the shower from the bedroom and by pressing a button you could make the window foggy and by pressing again clear and transparant. No clue what you woudl need that for, but it´s funny. The room is also equipped with a nice large flatscreen TV and a NESPRESSO machine (complimentary 3 capsules, one of them decaff.)! The breakfast buffet was pretty good as well. The only bothering thing was the capacity of the breakfast room. There was a queue of at least 25 people ahead of us. Fortunately it was Sunday, it was a family trip, not a business trip and the waiting time was only 15 minutes. In return we were not chared for the excellent breakrast buffet that would have costed us otherwise 16 Euros. When travelling with kids, you will find a nice play corner with lots of video games and some wooden blocks to play (Kapla). The service was not soo great. As I´ve mentioned the waiting time as pretty long for the breakfast and we needed a 3rd set of towels, because there was 3 adults in the room, but only 2 sets of towels. It took 2 hours and 3 telephone calls to the reception. Other than that the hotel experience was great and we would come again. In the meantime we hope that the service will improve a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, standard Novotel service”
Reviews.Author: BlueSquareThing
Reviews.Content: The Gare de Lyon is perhaps two minutes walk away - so you've got immediate access to the Metro, RER and main lines. That makes for a great location in a city like Paris, especially when the hotel is pretty central anyway. The hotel is modern and rooms utterly reasonable, especially if you can get a decent deal on the room and/or breakfast. The usual Novotel standard and the ability to put two kids in the same room as us makes Novotel a great brand. Our room looked out over the square at the back, which perhaps made it quieter. Breakfast was a good buffet spread and kids eat free. I'd certainly come back here next time we need to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A standard Novotel”
Reviews.Author: bhooooooo
Reviews.Content: A late booking for a family holiday and I wanted to ensure that we have a decent hotel. The room was perfect for a family with two small kids with fold-out sofas. The hotel is fairly modern and provides what is expected of a Novotel - clean, up-to-date interiors, basic facilities, a helpful reception and expensive meals. The breakfast is free for kids - and that makes it worthwhile overall. It is a great breakfast at the end of it all with crepes, eggs, different types of breads. The high-point for me was the choice and selection of tea that was available! Dinner is an expensive affair - a basic meal was 70 Euros for the four of us. We should have taken the trouble to get out a little more. The swimming pool is tiny (and not really kid friendly - but then, this is a business hotel!) with tinier changing rooms. The location is brilliant. Right outside the Gare De Lyon station. A 2 minute walk to the metro, a RER line, lots of buses and a taxi rank.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great service, a little far from the sites”
Reviews.Author: rbthodge
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many Novotels throughout Europe before and this one lives up to their quality/level of service and amenities. Staff was very friendly and helpful during check-in and throughout our stay. They were more than helpful with directions and suggestions for our time in Paris (6 nights). When we booked the hotel (online), I did not realize the distance between the hotel and the sites (Arc de Triomphe, Tour Eiffel, Notre Dame, etc.). It is a little distant - too far to walk, unless you really like long walks, but the metro station is located right next door in the train station and the metre in Paris if efficient and convient to all locations. Being right next door to the train station on a side street also has some disadvantages - some rough looking characters hanging around the side exits of the station and consequently the hotel doors are locked at night - you have to wave at the front desk personnel to get the doors opened for you if you arrive/come back late in the evening. Don`t take this as a big negative - I did not feel unsafe at any time, just not the best of surroundings. Would consider staying here again. For the price and the amenities (indoor pool), it was a deal compared to many other choices in the city. Novotel also has another site, located much closer to the Tour Eiffel, which also might be considered.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice of hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tusty1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 8 year old daughter and a friend and her 8 year old daughter. The rooms were a good size and included a sofa. The hotel staff were friendly and the girls were well catered for, they received a gift when we checked in and all staff were patient whilst they had a go with their French! There was a children's menu in the restaurant and a kids entertainer at breakfast (a bit wierd at breakfast but the kids loved it!). The location of the hotel was quite good - it cost us €60 in a taxi from CDG airport and the metro was really close for getting around Paris. I would choose to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel at a great location of Paris”
Reviews.Author: joymumu
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel is its location - right next to GDL main train station. You can access Metro, RER, SNCF, etc all types of train - say hardly 3-4 mins walk from the hotel. Again within 3-5 mins walk, you're right in the heart of GDL main downtown shopping area full of restaurants of all cuisines. Inside hotel is decent, rooms are quite spacious in comparison to Paris std. Hotel has a good gym, decent restaurant and bar. I liked the food also. Though the bathroom-WC are small, but it is in Paris and similar to the std. Overall, decent place to stay for both business and vacation purpose, if your work is in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and facilities but could do better”
Reviews.Author: AxelR0695
Reviews.Content: It was the second time I went to this hotel. This time, I could get a room with a double sofa for the price of a normal room; which was great as it is really enjoyable (and unusual) to have such a large room in Paris! However, again, I found the bed wasn't very comfortable (I would probably have been just as comfortable unfolding the sofa). I was also a bit disappointed the telephone did not work well and although I was told technicians would fix it...it was not. For some reason, I could call the receptions but incoming calls were not passing through. One night I could use Skype instead (internet is free) but it wasn't working well as the bandwidth is certainly not enough for video calls. I also didn't realise the breakfast was included. A good thing but I have never been really impressed by the breakfast. Coffee is placed in pots on your table, so it's never really hot nor tasty when you pour it and if you come late for breakfast, you may have to check on other table to find a pot with some coffee left. I'd much rather an instant coffee machine in the style of Nespresso machines. The orange juice is taken from concentrate juice mixed with ice which I do not like in the morning - not in any way as good as fresh orange juice, or, at least Tropicana/Innocent juices. There also are some pancakes but these are left under a red light which may improve their looks but does not keep them warm. Anyhow, apart from that, there is a good mix of fruits, yoghurt, pastries and other cooked breakfast food available, so if quality may not be great, at least there is a bit of variety. Overall, I was a bit disappointed as I did not have the time to enjoy the gym or swimming pool; I still think this is a good hotel, with a good location. It is great if you've got time to enjoy the facilities, but if you don't, it's just 'a good hotel, but nothing great.'

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly”
Reviews.Author: MelnotteMan
Reviews.Content: Great location for catching an early train out of Paris. Tolerant of an early arrival Christmas Day and gave us access to me of our rooms to dump our bags and have a showers after a long hall flight. Kids loved the computer games

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: U_LIV_1X
Reviews.Content: the hotel is very good to stay in, clean and the rooms are good sized. the bathroom is small, but it is Paris and the size standards are similar to Midtown Manhattan hotels. The location made this hotel, excellent to go around Paris for us (first time in Paris). The Metro station is close and of course the train station is very close (Gare de Lyon). We took the bus from the Airport to the train station stop and did the same thing on the way back. No need for Taxis or hauling the luggage through the Metro stops. The Air France bus is the easiest and most economical way to get to this hotel. Many restaurants in the are to choose from. I liked aa Turkish restaurant across the main street called: Adana.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and - on Paris scale - space”
Reviews.Author: alyonam
Reviews.Content: Very nice and reliable accommodation if you need a Bastille-Bercy district. Reliable in terms of room size and cleanliness and standards of service. Just two minutes from Gare de Lyon railway station, lots of supermarkets and restaurants (many of them are open in the late evening) and so on. Just 10-15 minutes by walk to Place des Vosges and just half an hour (or 5 minutes by subway) to Notre Dame. Big and comfortable bed, additional sofa, free wifi, kettle and minibar. Service is very nice, but long lines for check out - you'd better check out in the morning. Free gym is a nice feature.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel at Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: travelrelaxBasel Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent as the metro was nearby. We could go to the main attractions within 20-30 minutes via the metro. The room was clean and spacious. The bathroom was not very clean though and we could see stains on the side of the bathtub and hair on the bathroom floor when we first checked in. Breakfast was excellent and there was a magician / balloon man to entertain the kids, which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Goods stolen from the hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasant stay as the room was big and comfortable , but unfortunately one of my new sweater was stolen in the room. We have made a complaint with the front desk and still waiting for the outcome. My advise is to lock your bags as the housekeeping cannot be trusted. Overall it is a good hotel to stay but i hope the hotel is going to look into this matter of lost goods or their comments satisfaction gurantee is not valid.

Reviews.Title: “It was to hot to sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Heathcote27
Reviews.Content: I was transiting through Paris and had to catch an early train from Gare De Lyon; this would be the only reason to stay here. Beware it is a bad one! The hotel sits above the station in a busy part of town and is generally reasonable except that the heating was turned up to well over 20 degrees. This is far to hot to sleep. Opening the window provided some relief but the noise from the city also kept the sleep away. Bad way to start me short break in the wine regions of Burgundy. Very unusual to get such a bad experience from a Novotel, I have found them very reliable until this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great for family on the way to the South of France”
Reviews.Author: Nodel
Reviews.Content: I meant to write this review ages ago but forgot! We stayed here on our way done to the South of France on the TGV. The hotel was perfect. Very friendly staff, 24 hour use of the pool, nice room and one of the best breakfasts we have had at a hotel. We had to queue for breakfast but whilst we were waiting they gave our children little food boxes which they loved. Great restaurants around. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I felt a little like a processed unit.”
Reviews.Author: SoulTherapist
Reviews.Content: There are some hotels that make you feel wanted and cherished, others that make no pretence to be other than an efficient place to rest your head overnight and feel you a standard breakfast the next morning. The Novotel falls into the latter category. We were thankful for its proximity to the Gare de Lyon because we arrived on the 23.30pm from Milan and walked over the road from the station. The next morning, the breakfast buffet was limited in choice, especially if, like me, one has a dairy intolerance. Although prominently displayed is a notice saying either satisfaction or refund, when I mentioned it to the receptionist all I got in return was a shrug a few casual remarks about that being the way breakfast was. No soya milk, no low fat yogurts &c, things only cooked in butter, which for an international hotel of this size I found irritating. The choice of snack meals at the bar on arrival was limited and prepackaged. We were asked to eat in the middle of the foyer because they wanted to wash the floor of the bar, even though they were still open - just - giving once again that we were slight inconveniences, rather than a welcome guest, getting in the way of the staff's world. On the plus side, the beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was separate from the toilet. The staff were pleasant but impersonal, all that was needed for a night's transit.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but overpriced - aren't they all”
Reviews.Author: DDCHK
Reviews.Content: Was on a 2-night business trip so decided to stay within walking distance of the office. The rooms are small bu fine for 1 person. Got the queen standard for €239-299 per night. I suppose Paris hotels are really expensive and can get away with those prices without the equivalent service or quality. Toilet in a separate tiny closet from the sink and shower area. The entire bathroom seems to be made of plastic reminds me of Austin powers-like style from the 60s but drab. Bed I got wasn't too comfortable and pillows were too flat. Carpet was coming off near the walls. There is a sofa bed to accommodate 1 person or 2 kids. Wifi free. Bfast decent enough with creeps yoghurt salami cheese eggs bacon sausage croissant muffins breadand juice. Fruits didn't seem fresh. There is no bell service ao take note if you have huge suitcases. Have them call a taxi for you upon checkout since the hotel entrance is not in the main road but a side street. I guess with so many choices in the city there must be something of better value or maybe not. The hotel is functional and the room seems clean. To be honest just because of the convenience and the fact that a more comfortable hotel may cost €500 I will likely stay here in my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice & definitely not 4-star as advised prior to booking”
Reviews.Author: James O
Reviews.Content: I booked a hotel weekend break in Paris recently - using Lastminute.com & their 'Top Secret Hotels' deal. The description promised a 4-star hotel & central location & suitable for couples - & after booking - it was revealed to be the Novotel Paris Gare de Lyon. Upon arriving, I would definitely dis-agree & say this was a 2/3-star hotel. The immediate area wasn't very nice- and I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic get-away. My main complaints of the hotel were the itchy & cheap bed-linen, which was very uncomfortable & made it hard to get to sleep. the mattress was also not very comfortable. Also the room wasn't well ventilated, so got very hot at night. The fan/cooling system didn't seem very effective in the room either. the bathroom & toilet walls were plastic & claustrophobic. I also had an allergic reaction to the hotel shampoo- which made my scalp red & felt as if it had burnt. Anyway for the next day or so my head felt very sore. Overall it was definitely more of generic travel-lodge than a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the whole OK, but not more than that. Rooms were very hot and no airco available. Staff was not too friendly. Breakfast area was too crouded. A bit too expensive for what it offers

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: andybrown999
Reviews.Content: To be honest, it does what it says on the tin. It wasn't too expensive, but then again its a pretty depressing building. It reminded me of an NCP car par inside (not a good look). The room was OK, a bit spartan (the bathroom and toilet were like those you find in a caravan). I didn't eat at the hotel (either dinner or breakfast) because it was too pricey and looked a bit rubbish.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_and_Sarah
Reviews.Content: We booked this at short notice for a 4 night trip to Paris with our 14 month old daughter. Didn't get a great rate as was very last minute but was happy with the choice. Very conveniently located, steps away from Gare du Lyon, though took us a day to realise there is an exit from the metro concourse that comes out directly infront of the rear of the hotel, check the map before you leave home!) Rooms were generous sized with a sofabed as well as a double. Baby slept in a cot that had been requested and was waiting fully set up on arrival. Helpful staff, soft toy on arrival for daughter, childrens play area with some building blocks, books, play stations for the older kids and a tv playing cartoons. Swimming pool too which is 24h, though we didn't get the chance to use it. Breakfast was good - lots of choice, though the bacon,sausage,egg etc will disappoint english travellers - recommend sticking to the local fayre - great crusty bread, coffee/hot chocolate, croissnats, yogurt etc. Alsog good teas and teapots, innocent smoothies, cheese/salamis mmm. Very helpful barman (will remain nameless in case I get him into trouble) helped me out with ice and champage glasses for a bottle I'd bought in the supermarket for an in room celebration. Breakfast is expensive if it's not inclusive. Look out for the inclusive rates and special offers. We found the best rates booking direct on the hotel website. Also don't miss the newly developed shopping/restaurant development two metro stops south/east in Bercy. Great park nearby and wonderful shops and good family friendly eateries all conveniently located together in pedestrian development.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: avikeshan
Reviews.Content: We chose this Novotel hotel due to its excellent location. Just next to the Paris Gare de Lyon station, connections are never a problem. The Air France shuttle drops you almost opposite the hotel. We had an early morning train to Geneva, which was easier to catch due to the location. Breakfast was good, though you may have to queue up. Overall, it is a good value for money. Tip : Write/remember the Gare de Lyon exit gate no. / name which might be difficult to locate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: backInCanada
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in Paris with a 6 and 8 year old. If this sounds like you, then I would highly recommend this hotel for the services and value ...and in a way, location if you are driving in (secure parking), taking the train (next to Gare de Lyon) or travelling in Paris by Metro, or taxi (as taxis seem prentiful here). The one draw back is that the location os not the best for the typical central Paris sights. BUT, we did enjoy spending time in a Part of Paris that we often over look (St Martins canal, Bastile, the Marais) Given that this is a large, chain hotel with a high turnover in a big city......I think they do a very good job, especially geared to families. (free, pretty good breakfast for kids, a decent pool, play stations where my kids practiced their french WAY too late in the evening, free WiFi and also nice computers in lobby). The room was clean, and kid's were no extra cost for eur180-200/night. This is a BIG deal, as elsewhere, we have had to buy 2 adjoining rooms. i saw someone complain that the room was too small for afamily , but for our family of 4 , it was FINE....ESPECIALLY given the price. Yes, all in all 5 stars (I was going to give 4 n, but really, the fifth is for price and value) Oh yes...given the location, next to train station etc. VERY surprised how quiet the room was

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: bytor99
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel because of its location to the station and the family rooms. The whole experiance was great. Staff looked after us, especially the kids very well. Family room was just right and we didn't mind the little seperate loo at all. Will be booking this hotel again for our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “5 day stay with family”
Reviews.Author: dmcgarva
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 days with two young children. The room was very small considering it was sold to us as a family room. The toilet was ridiculously small, and struggled to close the door! The staff were good with providing and putting up the cot. It wasn't the most stable cot but it was clean. The breakfast was good, but you would expect so at 16 Euros per person. At least the kids ate free. The restaurant didn't open until 7pm which did not suit our family routine, which meant we ate out each night. There were plenty of cafes nearby so didn't cause a problem. The hotel is right next door to the railway station which is handy. There's also a kids play centre on the ground floor opposite the check in desk and lounge so we could leave them to get on with it while we sat and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “I chose it for its location”
Reviews.Author: KoolTan
Reviews.Content: Admittedly most hotels in Paris are expensive by comparison with say, those in Chamonix. But the Novotel certainly has a choice location, as it is just a short walk from the train station. We were completing our 2-week vacation in France with a 1-night stay at the Novotel, having disembarked at Gare de Lyon from Grenoble. It was easy to walk over to the Botanic Gardens although the weather had turned cold & grey by that time. If it had been nicer weather, we would probably have walked all the way to the Notre Dame. The swimming pool was a bit of a disappointment as it's small for the size of the hotel. We also had to trundle our heavy luggages down some flights of stairs from the Gare de Lyon which was not tourist-friendly at all.

Reviews.Title: “good,neat and tidy”
Reviews.Author: niraj_surana
Reviews.Content: Reasonably big rooms, well connected location to move in paris. Indians should stay at nord area for better dining options . overall pleasant stay

Reviews.Title: “Non-descript but adaquate...”
Reviews.Author: kcbn
Reviews.Content: I was forced to spend and extra night in Paris after I missed the last train home that day. As the closest hotel to the train station, this was the obvious choice since I had to be back in the station at 6:00 am! Anyway... The rooms were fine, the decor fine, the staff fine, the room service fine. All what you would expect from a big chain. My suggestion? If you are going to be in Paris for more than a business trip stay somewhere more authentic. There are so many fabulous places to choose from -- why stay in a hotel that could be in the middle of Boise Idaho, Birmingham England or Trenton New Jersey? Really, this hotel was FINE -- it just could have been anywhere in the world. And YOU want to be staying in PARIS!

Reviews.Title: “Central and convenient in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vossing
Reviews.Content: This hotel was conveniently located for exploring Paris. Close to the metro and the railway station. Easy to drive to and from Paris Orly Airport and Disneyland. The metro brings you easily around Paris. Buy a day pass og multi-day pass. The hotel offers a seperate breakfast area for families with children, which was very nice. Here you find entertainment for the children, even fun for adults... The hotel staff was helpful and friendly. English speaking. Get a room with a sleeping sofa if you have children. The sofa also offers good sleep quality. We will definitely consider going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very near train station”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne86
Reviews.Content: This hotel is near Gare de Lyon, make sure you come out of main entrance of station and turn right you will see Hotel sign before you reach the road turning. We were only at this hotel for one night, we were going to stay at Disneyparis so we made an early start and did not have breakfast. There were 5 in our party, so we booked twin and triple rooms, the rooms were comfortable and spacious after the italian hotels we stayed in. Reception was excellent, and we found it easy to find eating places very nearby. Would recommend this hotel and would say that possibly you could consider using this hotel to visit disney instead of moving to a hotel nearer to the park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faris010
Reviews.Content: We stayed with the kids 4 nights in this hotel. Very friendly Novotel. On saturdays they have special breakfast room for families with children, and everymorning they have some kind of acitivites for the kids during breakfast like magic or face painting. The beakast was good, no complains. They have a nice little pool and a nice entertainment room for the kids. The Hotel is close to the Gare de Lyon station where u can take the train to Disney park. And from the hotel it is 15 minutes walk to the Notre Dam Cathedral. There are allot of resturants and cafes around the hotel. The rooms were clean and the bedsoffa for the kids was comfortable, no complains. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “comme ci comme ca”
Reviews.Author: 20aloha08
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short family trip at the beginning of September for 4 nights. As a family of 5, we booked 2 rooms - a triple and a double. We arrived late evening but the staff were quick and efficient at processing our check-in and were able satisfy our request for 2 rooms in close proximity to each other, which were on the 4th floor. The rooms themselves were small but comfortable - both were "family" rooms - with a double and a sofa bed which opened into 2 singles. Whilst an OK base for us for 4 nights, we would feel that 4 people sharing the room for any length of time would begin to feel claustrophobic as when the sofa bed is pulled out there is almost no room to walk about. Storage facilities were not great and we almost did not have enough room for our 2 medium-sized suitcases - one was close to being stored in the bath! Ah, the bathroom! One of the most bizzare hotel bathrooms I have ever seen! The bathroom itself was rather large including both a full sized bath and seperate shower. The toilet, however, was in a seperate "room" slightly smaller than an aircraft toilet and without a sink. While this idea is, in theory, practical, a sink would be useful in the toilet for hygiene purposes! The lobby is clean and modern with an interesting circular design. Breakfast in the hotel was expensive, so we opted out - as the hotel is next door to Gare de Lyon station, there are plenty of other options in the nearby area which are a fraction of the price. You're not spoiled for choice in Paris!! We did not use the fitness centre within the hotel but there was a large glass window overlooking it from the 4th floor of the hotel and the facilities looked good and modern. The pool area looked clean if a little small. The location is ideal for exploring the city - right next to Gare de Lyon staion which has fantastic transport links on mainline trains, RER and Metro lines.

Reviews.Title: “terrific for family”
Reviews.Author: IanDaniel
Reviews.Content: We ( 2 adult 2 kids aged 10 and 12 ) had a very good stay here . Be sure to get a rate that includes the breakfast which was a highlight . Hard to find a room that can accomodate 4 people but this hotel has them . Good atmosphere . Staff were very helpful .Kids loved the wi fi and the fact that there were x boxes available on mezzanine level .

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room”
Reviews.Author: loulou179 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel easily after arriving at Garre de Lyon. Although our room wasnt ready, we were offered a courtesy drink each. We were then upgraded to a lovely room with a small balcony. very comfy beds.Friendly , helpful staff. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel near the station for our early start and we could walk a few hundred metres to the platform with our luggage and dog. This hotel also has a pool and gym and lots of restaurants and bistros nearby, but is not romantic or charming but is clean and modern and we got a good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but not outstanding...”
Reviews.Author: bernhard l
Reviews.Content: Convenient location, but surroundings are a bit seedy, especially at night. Rooms clean, comfortable, and reasonable sized for a typical city hotel but fairly small with an extra bed. Service is professional and helpful, but not particularly friendly. Parking is pricey, but convenient and safe. CAUTION CLAUSTROPHOBICS-Super tiny toilet room; like out of a small regional aircraft. Breakfast is pricey for adults, but alright for parents with children up to 14 eating free. Breakfast selection is acceptable but not too inspired. Overall, an acceptable choice for a stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, convenient for Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: A very comfortable hotel which we chose both because of the reliability of the Novotel brand and its proximity to the Gare de Lyon - literally three minutes from the main concourse - where we had a very early morning train to catch. The rooms were very good and pretty quiet and the children really enjoyed the indoor pool. Only criticism would be the limited capacity of the restaurant, although there are plenty of bars and restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I couldn't use the pool becasue it was alway full of children”
Reviews.Author: MrsRachett
Reviews.Content: I was happy to see that the hotel had a pool and brought my bathing suit so I could do a few laps during my stay. However, every time I've tried to use it today it's been full of children. First thing this morning teenage lovebirds had taken over the pool. "That's all right, I though, I'll swim in the evening before bed. I thought it would it would be nice to have a swim after a long hot day in the city." It's 11:30 at night and I just got back to the room from the pool. It's filled with primary school-aged children. There's no room for me to swim laps. I realise that children have every right to swim during their holiday, but when do I get to swim? These children are young. When is their bedtime?

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel, been several times now, great base to get around Paris”
Reviews.Author: GAILKELLY
Reviews.Content: Can't rave about this hotel enough. Big, modern, clean, great rooms, great location right on the No 1 metro line so easy to get about Paris. Been several times now and would not book anywhere else to stay. Staff are nice and speak English, very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect For What It Is”
Reviews.Author: Radtrav
Reviews.Content: A near perfect place for visiting Paris with family. One of the few hotels that defines kids up to age 15. Quite reasonable prices on the Novotel web site for pre- paid, decent location on Metro Line 1 and within 1/2 hr. walk of le Marais and Notre Dame, reasonable size rooms for three, in-room safe, good bathroom with walk-in shower and good soaps and shampoos, clean, good breakfast buffet and a very helpful staff. On the down side, a modern hotel without much atmosphere and not the most elegant corner of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good location to visit Paris - view on the Tour Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: KJMAD
Reviews.Content: Just to spend the weekend in Paris we were looking for a hotel not too far from the centre of Paris with to possibility to park the car in a private and closed garage. This was possible at the Novotel near to the Gare de Lyon. We got a nice room with view on the Tour Eiffel. On the ground floor we could use an indoor swimming pool and our childre were happy to use the playstation facilities (for free). Breakfast was very good. Only negative point was the service at the check-in. As we were too early, the room wasn't ready but it would only take some minutes. So we waited and waited, but no reaction. As we were reading a newspaper the staff didn't want to disturb us .... Not really professional, but beside of this, we were very happy to stay at Novotel Gare de Lyon. Tip: don't use the car but take the hop on-hop off bus (Open Tours). Tickets can be bought at the Gare the Lyon. You see a lot and it is all enjoying!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for Paris trip with family”
Reviews.Author: Navy147
Reviews.Content: Value for money is what you get in the hotel. Rooms are average sized, clean and equiped with basic facilities. We didn't use breakfast (16 Euro) in the hotel, but used a basic francaise breakfast (6,50 Euro) in the brasserie round the corner or a nice bacquete from one of the shops in Gare du Lyon (4 Euro. The bar and lounge are ok for a quick drink, but are not inviting (sterile) to have a cosy get together with friends or colleages. Tariff is very reaonable for what you get considering the location. With the metro all main Paris attractions are in short distance. WiFi in only available in the lobby and not in the room Annoying, since they advertise with wifi in the room and is considered a must have requirement for a lot of people nowadays when looking for a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great facility poor bed”
Reviews.Author: AxelR0695
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, and the fact the swimming pool as well as the gym are free of charge. However the bed felt as if it was a temporary bed, was making a bit of noise and was a bit uncomfortable. For the price of the room, I did expect a better bed! But again, the facilities and the location made up for it...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mand2020
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Paris I was recommended this hotel due to its proximity to the large Gare de Lyon train station. Thiss hotel was really clean and professionally run and the best thing is the location...easy access to all the sightseeing in Paris without being right in the middle of the hustle and bustle. Bar area was small and not open very late which was a bit disappointing but the restaurant and breakfast area was very good. Highly recommend if you are planning on visiting tourist areas of Paris utilising the great Train system.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: nilats
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June. The Gare du Lyon area itself is not the most charming part of Paris, but certainly not the worst. Great for public transport, especially to Disneyland. The rooms are fine for families - double bed and 2 pull-out beds. Large, modern bathroom. Very good breakfast, free for kids. Our children enjoyed the pool. I wouldn't stay here for a romantic break, but for a family holiday, it's a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “An American who would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: USATrvlMom
Reviews.Content: I was worried about finding a hotel to stay in Paris that I felt would be in a safe location, clean and budget friendly. I booked this hotel through their website well in advance of our trip and was able to get a very good rate in comparison to other hotels I was looking into. I was constantly checking all the new reviews on TripAdvisor hoping I would still only be hearing good things about this hotel. I was not disappointed with this hotel at all. It was prefectly located, right across the road from the Gare de Lyon, very very close to both the Open Top tour bus stop, and also to the Air France bus transport to CDG(just so you know you do not have to be traveling on Air France to use this service, I believe the cost was 16 or 17 euros per adult and about 8 euros per child). The room was clean and nice, and the kids especially loved the hotel's little children's room located just to the side of reception and VERY nicely placed near the two free (and very nice) computers for use. So i could check on my emails from home and tell everyone how much fun we were having in Paris while also being able to keep an eye on my little ones). If you are on the fence about which hotel to choose, i do not hesitate in suggesting this one and should i be in Paris again I will be staying here :)

Reviews.Title: “Cigarette room Not Marriott”
Reviews.Author: travelling-arab
Reviews.Content: Currently on day 2 of 3 day visit and having had a room next to lift to start now have an awful smoking room which i specifically did not book 6 months ago. Our throats are aching. Also the pool is freezing. First time novotel and back to good old marriott in future.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel but great location”
Reviews.Author: malehotbod
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during May-June for our trip to Paris. Though the hotel is very simple, however its location plays a good role in making this hotel a worth to stay. Property is just next to the train station in Gare de Lyon which has various connections to the trains and subways. There are a few restaurants down the road and more importantly, there is a pick-up point for the open tour bus just about 5 mins away from the hotel. Should you wish to take the airport limousine, the stop is just 5 mins away too. Generally rooms are well kept and there are 2 internet terminals for guest at the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: dr007Welkom Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 3 days and were very impressed with the service,rooms and location of the hotel. The station are next to the hotel and this made it very convenient. Area outside the station are a bit dodgy but did not affect our stay.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent choice for family travelers”
Reviews.Author: AQMRN
Reviews.Content: This property confirms for us that when looking for a good value American-style property in Europe, and especially in France, Novotel continues to be the way to go. This Novotel (a subsidary of the French ACCOR) is located within 1 minute pedestrian zone walk from Gare de Lyon railway station, thus providing an excellent, safe and easy access to the METRO and SNCF rail. Additionally, it is a 2-3 minute walk from several bus stations, including the most unreliable (we came to find out) Les Cars Air France airport bus /shuttle (line 4). You will not be able to get a TAXI without having it called into the hotel, unless you prefer to stand in a long line at the Gare de Lyon entrance. The neighborhood is understandingly busy, even though the immediate area near this Novotel is pedestrian (rear), appeared very safe and quiet (there was some construction noise in the rear room starting at 8am punctually). Even Gare de Lyon is very clean and business-like. There is a manned METRO booth at this station, eliminating the need to use automatic vending machines, should you need a more complicated or multi-day ticket. There are at least 5 large banks with many ATMs in the area, including BNP Paribas a short walk across the street from Gare. We found three Patisseries and at least one Boulangerie nearby (10 minutes walk) with an average quality and the usual Parisian fare. There were two decent size grocery stores within a 4 minutes walk. The hotel is a gray clean concrete block /steel-window building, standing about 10 floors tall and roughly triangularly-shaped, with the Novotel signs visible from all directions and on all walls. It appears modern and well taken care of. The front desk staff spoke English, was pleasant and helpful. The environment was business-like and comfortable. The service was prompt as was the checkout. The rooms were smaller in size, modestly equipped but with plenty of storage, clean and adequate for the four of us as we literally only slept there. The window did not close properly and required additional effort to secure which on the second floor caused us a slight anxiety. There was a sufficient size SAFE LOCK in the room. The bedding was clean. The swimming pool was narrower in size but plenty sufficient for a recreational swim and play. Overall, we would absolutely stay there again, given its convenient location, value and pleasant atmosphere. Thank you to managment for taking care of this property. We would appreciate more budget friendly deals for families wanting to spend several days in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Pool without towels and bad bar service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Receptionist will tell you that you can eat brekfast from 6:30 on saturday, however you need to wait 30 minutues to open (because it really will start at 7:00), can assure you that you do not need your own towels in the swiming pool and of cource when you appear there you canot find any of hotel towels; and when you ask for beer in the bar you will wait 20 minutes for nothing and finally you will need to go out to the neigborhood restaurant where they know how treat you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Moderate Well Priced Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alesmond
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel in early July. The location is excellent, just steps from the Gare de Lyon metro/train station. Very easy commute in from the airport. Relatively close to the Bastile in the 12th Ar. Hotel is modern and clean with not much European charm. It is a well priced Paris hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping was sporadic, most times not cleaning the room till after 5pm. We would consider staying here again because of the location and cost. Maybe be a little noisy at night because it is right across the street from a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the Gare de Lyon and very acceptable”
Reviews.Author: What
Reviews.Content: About as ugly an exterior as could be imagined, but inside a very satisfactory hotel. Room was excellent, service was friendly and efficient and breakfast was was also excellent (albeit expensive). Main plus is that it is a two minute walk to the Gare de Lyon and the metro. Wouldn't stay here other than for the convenience but there is nothinbg wrong with staying for a lengthier visit if you don't mind the unromantic location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience this trip”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1aUK Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this stay did not live up to the standard of our stays at other Novotel properties. While it has a good location and is, so far as I can tell, the only 3 star hotel in Paris with a swimming pool, there were several problems. There was a greasy handprint on the wall next to the bed which could easily have been removed had the cleaners been more attentive. The breakfast buffet ran out of some key items of food 30 minutes before the end of breakfast. But the most annoying thing was that a white top left neatly foled on top of the bed was bundled up with the sheets and sent off to the laundry by the cleaners. When the missing item was reported to the desk staff they promised to phone me back but did not, so I had to chase them several times. After two days they eventually told me they had contacted the laundry and asked them to search for the missing item. At the end of my stay they did offer to pay for a replacement, but the missing item was irreplaceable. The cleaning staff should have been more attentive and the desk staff should have responded more quickly.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Located next to the Gare de Lyon, the hotel is very convenient for the families. Enjoyed the hotel stay. The aircon in my room was not functioning well. However, a staff member responded to our call within minutes and provided solutions. We appreciated it very much.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel - above average but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: kelenmelisa
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right next to the Gare de Lyon Station, so it is convenient to get to places. However the area around the station is dirty and smelly. I also lost my wallet in this station, so I don't have a good memory of this place. Having said that, the hotel itself was clean, basic and modern. The room was not big, we had a queen bed and 2 seater sofa bed, which basically took up all the space in the room. Internet was complimentary which is always a bonus! There was also kids room, which was not as big or as exciting as I thought it would be, not enough to entertain my 3 years old anyway. The books were all in french. But he was given a seal soft toy from reception at check-in, which made his day! There are many cafes and restaurants just a short walk from the hotel. This area is not far from the main attractions, just a few stops away on the train. We chose this hotel due to its proximity to Gare du Nord where our train stop from London and Gare Bercy where our train left for Rome. It's about 10 Euro to Gare Bercy by taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, comfortable, easy to find & get to, would definitely return”
Reviews.Author: kelliewg
Reviews.Content: I recently accompanied my husband on a business trip to Paris (8 nights), and stayed at the Novotel at Gare de Lyon. We were concerned about staying in a "chain hotel" but found it to be exactly what we needed. The location is right next to Gare de Lyon, which made transportation extremely easy to access (Metro, RER, taxis, buses, tour buses, etc), as well as making it simple to get back from anywhere in the city (just head toward Gare de Lyon). It's a 2 minute walk to the train station, Metro or bus stops. There are cafes within a 2-3minute walk. And although it's right next to Gare de Lyon, we did not hear any train/traffic noises in our room at all. The room was nicely sized, with a firm but comfortable bed. There is a separate WC, then a tub, walk-in shower and sink in the other room. Plenty of counter space. Lots of closet and drawer space. TV was a little small for the room and only had one channel in English (CNN). Small couch and a nicely sized desk as well. Wifi worked well in the room and was included. The room was made nicely every day. Indoor pool downstairs was clean. Desk staff was gracious and helpful to all requests. We absolutely loved the breakfast (was included in corp rate, might not be for all reservations) - crepes, eggs, bacon, sausage, cheeses, croissants, tea, coffee, juices, etc... We normally didn't need to eat until dinner after this large breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant and comfortable experience”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the hotel and our room. We booked online from Australia and got a good room rate - much cheaper than what was displayed at the counter on the day we checked in. Friends had told us that French hotel rooms were very small but not so in this case - there was plenty of room and it was what we would consider to be a 'normal' standard room size (at least in Australian terms). It had everything supplied that you would need including tea and coffee facilities, it was perfectly clean, had a very comfortable bed, there was free internet downstairs, and it was very quiet even though it was right next to the train station which was a big plus. The 'plastic' modular bathroom and toilet was a surprise - although it meant no mould, so another plus there. Only possible negative point - given the very large size of some people these days we didn't see how a very large person could fit into the tiny separate toilet.

Reviews.Title: “paris 1 Night”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Location next to Gare de Lyon was perfect and service at check in and checkout friendly. Also getting around to see major attractions was easy as only minutes from Metro. Service particular during breakfast was extremly poor with staff looking the other way, not bothering removing dirtt on floor or clearing tables. Same poor cleanleness in room with carpets poorly stained and bathroom dirt marks. We had 3 rooms and all agreed with above.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, problem outside the hotel”
Reviews.Author: rpripr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. The hotel room was spacious, nice and clean. The hotel is located very near to the Gare De Lyon station, so metro/tube connectivity was good. We had a comfortable stay. There is a free internet connectivity provided with a LAN connection. Wish wifi was provided. Breakfast was good with lot of variety. It does get quite crowded. The staff were helpful and helped with directions/information. The area outside the hotel was very dirty & smelly. Never really felt comfortable. There was an issue in the billing. I had done my booking long back at the Novotel website, however the bill presented had higher rates which I had to get corrected. The checkout took quite a while.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable family hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chuckwash
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Novotel Gare de Lyon twice now, both times with wife and children and assorted relatives in tow, and I am booked for a third visit in the summer of 2011. Although the hotel is not particularly close to Paris attractions, those who take the trouble to walk along the Seine and across Ile St-Louis to Ile de la Cité won't be disappointed, and public transit is close by and efficient. There are also numerous restos, fast-food joints, and a Monoprix supermarket nearby, in addition to the hotel restaurant. Breakfast is large and varied. The rooms are not especially spacious, but they are comfortable. The pool is a boon to families with kids who have had enough of sightseeing. I must also single out the staff. They were very accommodating of older relatives who arrived early in the morning after a long transatlantic flight, for which we are grateful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: dogs123MahoneBay
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. Friendly staff, close to all buses and subway. Air France bus will take you to their bus stop which is almost directly in front of the hotel. Rooms are a good size, for Paris standards. Fantastic seafood restaurant across the street and a lovely French café.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for seeing Paris and Disneyland”
Reviews.Author: AlexanderW1
Reviews.Content: Reception was always very friendly and attentive to guests. Wait time for check in was very low. The kids received two stuffed little animals to take away. This is really friendly. The rooms are well equipped with two extra fold out beds for the children. For Paris the room was large, in reality is was OK. It was nicely decorated and the bathroom was very well equipped and always kept clean by the staff. The toilet is separate, which is great in a family of four. All in all quite a good room, had it been to the back side of the hotel, where there is a pedestrian zone. Had we know that fact, I would have asked for it. Unfortunately the room was to the front / street side and we had to close for the night, as bypassing cars in the small one-way street would have waken us up. The air condition made the climate comfortable though. The ground floor pool was a hit for the children not so much for the parents, as the kids rather wanted to get back to the hotel for the pool and no longer see anything downtown. Breakfast was great in the restaurant. At later times it's a little busy and one had to wait a few minutes to get in. To the end some of the food items were gone and no longer replaced. The location of the hotel itself is excellent with all the SNCF, metro and RER trains leaving from Gare de Lyon, which is only two minutes from the hotel entrance. Very comfortable to and from the CDG airport is also using the Roissy bus stopping in front of the main station terminal. We used the bus on our arrival. If you're leaving with metro or RER, we faced a big problem in buying tickets, as the machines would only accept coins, no banknotes and no credit cards. The queue at the only service desk was very long. We bought several individual items at the station in order to get some coins for paying the metro trip to the Eiffel tower. The wait time at the Eiffel was even longer, about 2 to 3 hours, also very long wait at the one pillar where one can use the steps instead of the elevator. I later checked the advance tickets on the Internet site of Eiffel. They were sold for almost two weeks. So get your tickets well in advance, if you'd like to go up on Eiffel tower ! Going to Disneyland is quite easy, as trains run every 10 minutes and it is a 40 mins ride to the terminal station of RER train line A4 (Marne-la-valee). The drawback here is that you enter the park only with the public at 10 am, when the guests of the Disney hotels are already in for 2 hours, have done already some rides and booked there Fastback tickets. If we'd ever go back to Euro-Disney (don't think so right now -this is a money trap and mainly good for the share holders of Disney) we'll most propably stay at one of the Disney hotels for the early entrance from 8 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: RainInManchester
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel in late April. It's right next to Gare de Lyon and we were able to park breifly outside and unload the car. The Reception area is well staffed and clean. We have stayed here once before as a base for visiting Paris - and it's perfectly located. The room was large enough for the three of us - two adults and a five year old. There was capcacity for four beds (two were easily folded down. The kettle is fine, but take your own English Breakfast tea if you're not keen on Green Tea, likewise with UHT milk; cups are plastic too. The bathroom was fine - I did find one hair (... not great!) and the toilet which was separate, though clean had a slight niff of wee. My husband and son visited the swimming pool - the pool though probably clean has grouting leeching into it and they were left unimpressed. However, there were exciting views from the window of station life for our five year old - passengers, street hockey etc - but no disturbance from the noise. The temperature was also fine. We didn't eat breakfast or dinner in the restaurant, but when we stayed previously this was fine. We looked around the locality for a restaurant for dinner - just around the corner is a really good English speaking Italian restaurant called 'Dolce Vita' which serves lovely pizza, spaghetti bolognaise, salads etc. Many French people were eating there, some even taking away food. My husband and son enjoyed watching Manchester United play football on the TV behind my head - there was a nice atmosphere. The only thing which let it down was the time it took for the bill to come, but by this stage, the tables were all full. We loved this hotel when we stayed here previously - it was clean and new; now, some four years later, it's not quite as sparkling, but we'd still consider staying here again for its location and reliability.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value, great for kids”
Reviews.Author: jude101
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights over May day weekend. We got a great deal - £116 for a quad room with breakfast per night. Take Exit 9 or 11 from the Gare du Lyon to access the hotel quickly. The room was great, enough room for us all, with TV and air con which was working fine. The staff were fantastic and courteous despite obvious pressure on check in desks, especially Stephane. Breakfast was plentiful although the French can't do bacon!! We didn't have to queue despite coming down at peak times. The kids loved the pool and games room, the macs were a nice touch as well. The only tiny quibble was the toilet and bathroom fittings were plastic and looked a little cheap and nasty compared to other Novotels I have stayed in. The hotel is central to the metro and rer/sncf and was quiet and comfortable. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel to visitors, it was a 10 min stroll to the Bastille, a 5 min metro ride to Notre Dame, a 10 min train ride to Eiffel tower. It is near some nice restaurants and despite being at the station, wasn't noisy and never felt unsafe.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: jdlowe31
Reviews.Content: Novotel Gare de Lyon is right next to Gare de Lyon Station (exit 9). It is next to the metro stop, which means transport by train is close by, but also it is surrounded by food shops and even has a little supermarket across the road. The bed was excellent, although the separate toilet was a little confined. We used the pool every day. It was open 24/7, and every thing we asked of the staff was done without question. We loved the full and varied breakfast and enjoyed our stay. The Paris Metro was only 4-7 stops before getting to the tourist areas on the yellow line.

Reviews.Title: “Room temperate uncontrollable”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very pleasant. Normally I stay at the Mercure in Paris but decided to move to a more upscale hotel because I had hoped to find air conditioning that worked. Unfortunately the air conditioning at Novotel functions no better than at the Mercure. The room temperature is 26 to 27 C which is too warm for comfort. I have received explanations from the staff that it is the "heating season" and that the system is adjusting to the outside temperature. I recently stayed at a Novotel in Brussels that had no difficulty providing the desired room temperature. The hotel advertises that its rooms are climate controlled. Certainly, they are not in March and April. The hotel fails to deliver on this which detracts from its value for money as it is not inexpensive. Other than this failing, I would have no problem with recommending this otherwise very good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Overall: a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: jaxin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel Gare de Lyon with our two daughters. One of the primary factors in our choice was the availability of pull-out sofas for our children. The hotel is located right by the Gare de Lyon train station, with ready access to the RER and Metro. It's easiest to access the hotel via Sorties 9 or 11 from the station. The signage in the station, however, is abysmal, and maps usually are located nowhere near where you really need them. The room was of adequate size, while the toilet was very small. The toilet lever had to be flipped a second time with every flushing to make it stop running. There were no washcloths in the bathroom (which seems to be common in Europe), only hand towels and bath towels. We were usually not replenished with enough towels for a family of four, but it wasn't hard to track some down. There was somewhat limited closet space, and no iron/ironing board (which also seems common for Europe). The double bed was large and comfortable, and the pull-out beds drew no complaints from my kids. I believe all of those were recently replaced. As with many large, older buildings, the air conditioning is on a chiller system. This means the entire hotel has to be switched at once from heating mode in the winter to cooling mode in the spring. The hotel had not been switched over to cooling mode, so the air conditioning was not functioning. It was a particularly warm week in Paris, so the room was quite warm. The window opened, but there was no real ventilation possible without propping the room door open. We could not, of course, do this at night for security reasons. The room was passable at night with the window open. There was a disturbance at the hostel across the street one night, and the noise prompted me to call the front desk to have it addressed. Other street noise was not as bad, but still noticeable. I'm sure it would have been fine with air conditioning on and window closed. There is complimentary WiFi in the room, but it is only suitable for email/chat/ and general surfing. If you want to use Skype, you'll probably have to purchase one of the higher-bandwidth connections. The staff was generally courteous; one night I was trying to print out online tickets for the Eiffel tower. The printer at the hotel's little computer nook was not working, so the gentleman at the front desk printed the documents on the printer behind their desk after trying unsuccessfully to revive the other one. We did not try the breakfast or the pool. All in all, I think we would stay again, a the location is very good and price OK. My biggest gripe was the air conditioning. After the thousands of years humans have spent learning to control their environment, I ought to be able to have comfortable sleeping conditions for my hard-earned money! Something as simple as an operable vent in the room door to allow cross-ventilation in the room with the window open would be a workable solution.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy with room size!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in Novotel before as well. I liked there services. But this time when i went with my family(wife & 2 children) i observed that they offered me room of same size when i use to stay alone. I was very disappointed with that. I continued as i didnt want my trip to start with argument. Had i known this in advance i would have booked another room.

Reviews.Title: “Flattering reviews and pictures, very disapointing result”
Reviews.Author: hosteratu
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a very attractive location, has been refurbished recently and has a pool! On the top of that the pictures and reviews were very nice... I realize the reviews I read were a few months old, an apparently some things have changed. Everything about the Novotel Gare de Lyon now seems already old. The bathrooms and toilets are dirty and defect. I would definitely not recommend the pool which suffers from bad maintenance, with dirty floors etc. Breakfast room is tiny for the sze of the hotel, eventhough there are posters in the elevators recommending to avoid rush hours, expect a lot of stress and waiing in line for breakfast. In conclusion, the hotel needs its management to review its routines!

Reviews.Title: “Very disapointing”
Reviews.Author: CyranoGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: I know the Accor hotels very well and have often stayed in Novotels around Europe and also Canada. The reviews on Tripadvisor were very flattering for the Novotel Gare de Lyon, and I was expecting a similar standard as e.g. the Novotel in Munich on Hochst. where I stay often which also has a pool and is indeed very good and clean. I was extremely disapointed by the the Novotel Gare de Lyon. The hotel looks to have been refurbished recently with a new modern style, in reality it is very badly kept and both poor cleaning and maintenance have made this hotel become worn out very prematurely when you would expect it to still be fresh and clean. The pool and its surroundings are plain dirty and I was feeling bad letting the kids bathing there: they had been looking forward to this after seeing the pictures on the website... never trust pictures on the Internet! Above all the bathroom and toilet in the room were simply disgusting. Even though I very politely asked the reception to help a couple of times and later on even bribed the cleaning lady with 10 euros, the toilet still smelled like a urinal outside the nearby train station.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: grj11188
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located across the road from the Gare De Lyon which allows easy access to the Bastille, Louvre and other places of interest. The hotel is very basic and well suited for a quite stopover or business meet in Paris. Rooms are small but comfortable although the bathrooms are quite small and outdated. The breakfast although standard could have been a bit better

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to get around Paris”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Next to Gare de Lyon, and on all major metro lines, this is a perfect location to stay in Paris. It get just get a bit noisy when you have room overlooking the main square.

Reviews.Title: “Novotel Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location next to Gare de Lyon. However, not geared up to early breakfasts. Had expected to be able to get breakfast in room at 7.00 on a Sunday to be able to catch early train, but this was not possible. Expect a hotel of this quality to be able to offer this service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in the Novotel Chain”
Reviews.Author: tranzactnow
Reviews.Content: You will see from my other postings that my family has stayed in a number of Novotel properties. This one to our thinking was the best of the lot. The hotel is of a good quality. We found the room and bathroom clean and more than adequate. The staff spoke English and were helpful, free internet in the common area was available, fitness centre, pool, a useful interactive Paris transport map was in operation and a games room for children. Although we did not make use of the restaurant facilities they looked good. The separate bar served lovely cold beer and it was restful sitting in the lounge having a quiet drink. The hotel is located right next to the Gare de Lyon station (TIP: Take exit 9).
