We arrived in Paris via Eurostar from Paris at Gare De Nord and found that it was a one line, few station trip to Gare de Lyon from De Nord - simple, even with 4 suitcases and two children in tow. There are numerous restaurants and French bakeries in the near vicinity and being next to the train station, transport to anywhere in Paris was not a problem. I recommend this hotel for family groups.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: laetitiaGermany
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at Novotel Paris Gare de Lyon, although the room was a bit small and the staff was not very friendly. There was a lot of people there, and the staff didn´t take care for the clients as it should be, maybe because they were few for all the clients. The location is very good, just near the metro station, and the Lyon Station of trains. We didn´t take the breakfast, but we saw from outside that was well-served, as always is in the Novotel chain. The room was clean, the bathroom with bathtub, and we had a pleasant stay with the children, who slept well in the sofa that was arranged.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice large room”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice and quite spacious, too bad I didn't spend more time in it. Only problem is that it was hard to find coming out of the metro so make sure to locate it on a map before coming. I found the toilet to be a little small but otherwise everything was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great offer, good hotel on superb location but lousy couch to sleep on”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly situated next to the Gare the Lyon, and a big metro.It has its own parking lot. A nice swimming pool and a good breakfast make the deal complete. The room was good, the bathroom as well. Our only comment is that the two additional beds (a combined sofa and two beds in it) are just too bad to sleep on for big children as we have. As it was sold to be a bed for an adult we were just dispoointed in that.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - novotel never let me down”
Reviews.Author: OLT
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this Novotel for 4 nights - with 2 kids. the hotel/ room was always clean with good service and an excellent breakfast!!! the location was great!!! and i would certainly return in the future!!! the kids loved the pool.....

Reviews.Title: “Quality is as expected for a Novotel. Price is a little high.”
Reviews.Author: fed83
Reviews.Content: Good quality Novotel hotel. Clean, spacious rooms. Bathroom is a little smaller than I'd like. Location is great, at the rear entrance of the gare de Lyon. Price is high though. You're mostly paying for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ruthy01545
Reviews.Content: Right outside a mayor train hub. Nice places right outside to have some wine and dessert before turnng in. Not super close to mayor spots, but jump on the underground and be there in no-time. Near the train station is a little sketchy, but never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Not to international standard”
Reviews.Author: wifiaccess123
Reviews.Content: I was deeply disappointed by this hotel. It is not set up for international business travellers - all electrical plugs are european; the hotel refuses to lend adapters but wishes to sell them at 13 euros each! The foreign plugs for shavers have intermittent current. - The voicemail, wake up call, etc are all in French; no translations to other languages, and reception cannot tell you how to access the services. - The free wifi does not allow skype or anything other than web surfing. It is 15 euros per day for high speed internet. - The staff are unapologetic and brusque. I will not stay here again nor recommend it to others. Far cheaper hotels have courtesy, kindness, and put customers first. This one wants your money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Mandyprintmaker
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from a great 2 night stay for our daughters 10th birthday. The welcome was warm and friendly, the room was comfortable and the public areas spacious and clean. Great location for sightseeing, right next to the Gare de Lyon. Also not far to walk to the Batobus for hopping on and off sightseeing. Excellent choice for breakfast, with hot coffee, milk and hot water already served on the table. A good selection of juices too. The staff were so friendly and helpful. A very pleasant bar, with good food on offer. Great facility for leaving your luggage securely after the checkout time. The family all agreed we would like to return here, Well done Novotel, great customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Typical business hotel ... easy, great to get the train...”
Reviews.Author: wanderingtraveler60
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but, easy to check in, everyone spoke English, decent exercise area, pool, wifi, nothing special rooms but clean etc., and next to the train station which is great! -- Basic business hotel... inexpensive restaurants around... don't expect anything special....

Reviews.Title: “Compact - but comfortable”
Reviews.Author: FlossFairy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is alongside Gare de Lyon railway station - making it a convenient location as everything is so easy to get to by rail. Use exit 9 if you can find it ... I didn't find it till my last day! we used the weekly rail pass as we arrived on a Monday Wi Fi was free in the hotel - there were also computers in the lobby which were free. The bathroom had the cutest little bath squished under the vanity - which was needed to soothe tired, aching muscles from all the walking you do around Paris. Close by is a bakery where you can pick up a filled baguette to take away for lunch. There is also a Franprix nearby so you can buy wine, snacks and drinks - no space to put extras in the minibar fridge though lots of cafes around as well.

Reviews.Title: “Just what I needed”
Reviews.Author: dunnitt
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Novotels all over Europe and have always been more than satisfied. I can live without French "budget" hotels with their small, noisy,poorly ventilated rooms, uncertain plumbing, minimal breakfasts and surly staff, so the Novotel with its standardised, clean, comfortable facilities and helpful staff was just what I needed. The location is excellent for bus/ metro/ RER Paris transport links. The hotel is very close to the Opera Bastille- the purpose of my visit was to go to the opera and the Monet exhibition at the Grand Palais- and to the lovely Marais district, and to good restaurants, such as Le Train Bleu- a very upmarket staion buffet- Bofinger and Au Biche du Bois. Don't bother with breakfast in the hotel as there are several good, cheap,authentic cafes in the immediate area. As always in France, it pays dividends to speak some French. Finally, a tourist tip: do not miss the fantastic stained glass windows in the church of Ste Chapelle, which is tucked away in the courtyard of the Palais de Justice.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated base for travelling around Paris”
Reviews.Author: CrazyHorseOban
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 days on a room only basis October 2010. Check in was easy and staff friendly and English spoken. Room was clean and well appointed and sofa bed for our daughter was easy to set up. The hotel is adjacent to the Gare De Lyon station and, if you can find the right exit to use from the station -which isn't easy given the size of the station-then you are virtually at the hotel. The Boulevard Diderot beside the hotel has many options for eating, drinking and shopping and you can walk easily to the Bastille which has a market on Sunday. Within easy walking distance also from The Notre Dame. Only down side for us was that our daughter couldn't get the free WIFI to work on her IPod. Otherwise, no complaints and would certainly recommend for location and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but at that price could get slightly better”
Reviews.Author: RohanVaswani
Reviews.Content: We arrived late into the hotel as we missed out flight to Toulon and hence docked at Paris for a night. Main reason we chose this hotel is because its a minute away from the Gare De Lyon and didnt want to take any more chances of missing our trains/flights. Hotel was nice but a reminded us more of a business hotel. We took up the suite as the rest was all booked. For 240 euros, we could have definitely got better value for money elsewhere. Staff was not too friendly. Rooms were nice and spacious but if one is paying for a suite, would have expected it to be slightly better. All in all it wasnt too bad, but if other options are available, would count on them.

Reviews.Title: “Ok - staff are hit and miss - sometimes nice other times not so nice”
Reviews.Author: ANK09
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok - I wouldn't say its excellent for the price you pay. Location is good but you have to make sure that you get a room away from the elevator and not on the side of the Gare De Lyon station otherwise you will find that the noise will keep you up. The beds are hard in this hotel so be prepared to get back ache if you are used to a soft bed. I am a business traveller and have stayed at the hotels for 5 weeks and every weekend when I go home I have really bad back ache. If you require to iron your cloths make sure you bring a small travel iron as out of the 5 weeks I have only managed to get an iron for one of the weeks. If they do not have one then they send you to a small room on the first floor to where there is an iron. Problem is, is that you have to take all of your stuff there - not very nice for an international hotel. There is a small gym in the hotel can be busy in the evening but better then other hotels in the area in this respect. Positive - free wifi throughout the hotel - this is excellent.....

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: zarniwoop
Reviews.Content: Was a little apprehensive about the location as I'd heard gare de lyon area was a bit seedy, nothing of the sort. The station side exit does open out onto a big space where a few dodgy characters hang out but you can avoid this by using the front entrance. Parking a bit difficult to locate but we got there in the end, initially parked in the station car park which looks to be directly under the hotel from the road. Room was clean, well appointed for a family of four with two small children. Used the restaurant on our first night and we were surprised how good it was for a Novotel. We like to explore on foot and you can walk along the Seinne to Notre Dame, past the Louvre and onto Place de la Concorde. Staff were friendly and breakfast sufficient if a little chaotic. Overall a good base for paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for the station”
Reviews.Author: Hadleightraveller
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel near the Gare de Lyon as we had an early train, and the Novotel is 5 minutes from the platform! Having stayed in Novotels before I knew what to expect, and I was not disappointed. The room was clean and tidy, and the hotel nice and airy. The bathroom, whilst a bit drab, had both a bath and separate shower and both were good. The bed was nice and comfortable and we had a good sleep, as the hotel was quite quiet. There are plenty of places to eat nearby, and we can definitely recommend La Valise, 36 Boulevard Diderot. Overall, whilst a fairly standard hotel, we would recommend it if you need the Gare de Lyon - I booked this direct with Novotel as this turned out to be the cheapest option.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cbcjock
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July 2010 with friends. Front Desk - Nice staff and very helpful. However the concierge was useless. They sent us to the wrong area twice and even to a museum thats closed for the next 2 years and has been closed for a year. We thought it was closed but they said it wasn't, so we went against our judgement. Secondly we asked for a market to go to and were sent to the North of Paris. To those from outside Paris the north is not really a place you should go. From friends who live in Paris it can be a hot bed of trouble and not somewhere to venture freely. So be careful! Rooms - Good rooms and decent beds. I don't understand the two bathroom set up i.e. One room is the toilet and the other is the main bathroom. The toilet is quite small as a result. Shower is dreadful in my opinion. Pool - Excellent as its open 24 hours! Location - This hotel is in a great location. Get a Metro pass and you are sorted for all your site seeing. Your at most 20 minutes from any location in Paris. Its also extremely easy to get to and from the Airport. DIsneyland is also one RER train away. Breakfast - I'll go against most people and say breakfast was excellent. Lots of choice and you could certainly stock up and skip lunch as a result. It can be busy however but to their credit they opened a 1st floor room to serve breakfast so the queue was alleviated.

Reviews.Title: “typical Novotel”
Reviews.Author: AlphonseGlasgow
Reviews.Content: nothing more.nothing less. Central to Paris.usual decoration.usual overprice.usual quality(good quality).

Reviews.Title: “Good for families, but avoid breakfast here”
Reviews.Author: blazingfingers
Reviews.Content: It's difficult to find a hotel in Paris that will accommodate a family of four AND that has air conditioning. Novotel Gare de Lyon did both, and we got a good promotional rate (it's not worth it for any higher rate, though). Space is tight-ish but adequate, design very hip and trendy, location dull but easily accessible with good proximity to Gare de Lyon and Metro line #1. Internet is free, children's play room is a welcome amenity, and the indoor pool is warm (but deep--children will require constant supervision). Breakfast, however, is an absolute disaster, with great variation in what we received, when we received it, and how long the (surly) service took. One morning we couldn't get sugar or spoons for our coffee; another morning we were promised fruit that never arrived; often the lone server would simply disappear for extended periods. On the last morning we nearly missed our train when no one appeared to help us for 25 minutes! Take advantage of the numerous cafes offering a more reasonably priced petit dejuneur in the area if you stay here. It does have its advantages, especially if you get a good promo rate, and it also has good access to Euro Disney, with discounted entrance prices and only one RER train to the park. However, the restaurant is an overpriced nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful front desk staff, good location.”
Reviews.Author: deepak41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for money. centrally located near theRailway station. The lift to the station opens right in front of the hotel. The staff was very helpful. Specially the front desk was very good and always ready with information. Breakfast was simple but well laid. Overall it was a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facilities, poor service”
Reviews.Author: Paul-SArlington
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nites on holiday with my wife in May 2010. Was really surprised at how nice the hotel facilities are. The room was actually a very good size with a comfortable bed, nice bathroom (the small toilet room was not a big deal), good shower by European standards, and a nice view out back facing the train station. We got a very good rate on orbitz which included breakfast. Unfortunately breakfast was pretty bad and extremely crowded and chaotic. It's much better to head out to the street where you can get much better food, esp. if it is not included with your room. The regular rate for breakfast is 16 euros in the hotel. It's probably not worth 5. If this hotel had better service I would have rated it higher. I generally don't pay much attention to service, but this place stood out for the wrong reasons. Our room safe kept malfunctioning. The first time it broke someone came up right away and fixed it in 5 minutes. The second time, a couple of days later, no one came after 20 minutes so I called down again. W/o any provocation, the woman who answered the phone rudely told me someone would be up and nearly hung up on me. Then no one showed for an hour and a half. When the person did show up, they fixed the safe, then told me it wasn't broken, implying I should not have called for help. Not the way to treat your guests. The second service issue was equally strange. I had read b/4 we arrived that the fridge has sensors in it, and it is pretty obvious. But when we checked in, there was actually one open space in there so I opened it and put a bottle of water in there. A couple of days later, the maid removed our water from the fridge, replaced it with one of the hotel's beverages, and threw our bottle away. Not only that, they remotely locked the fridge from the front desk after they threw our bottle away. I am not making this up. I went down to the front desk and told them what happened. The woman at the front desk pretended she was completely clueless about what happened, but did conveniently unlock the fridge. One side note, every time I approached the front desk, I had to repeat myself b/c no one seemed to understand English very well. The location of the hotel is actually not bad at all. You can walk to downtown if you like to walk. It takes about 30 minutes to get to Notre Dame. And in addition to the subway and train connections there are many buses that you can take advantage of, if you are not too fond of the subway like us. You can actually go down to the information booth in the subway and they will not only tell you what bus to take, but print out bus directions for you. Bus 87 will take you to the Eiffel Tower. We bought 5-day Visit Paris passes which were well worth it. Another huge advantage to this hotel is that you can take the Air France shuttle line 4 basically directly to the hotel. The bus stop at Gare de Lyon is about 50 yards from the hotel front door. This will save you alot of money if you are on your own, and a bit less if you are travelling with someone. A roundtrip ticket on the bus is 26 euros, if I remember correctly, and a cab is about 55 euros one way. We had to take a cab when we arrived b/c there was a one-day AF bus strike. Oh, and there are bicycles for rent literally right out the front door - if that's your thing. The Gare de Lyon neighborhood is not bad. There are many restaurants within walking distance, including several where you can carry out. None was particularly worth mentioning. On a good note, many of them are open very very late if not all night. And even though the hotel is next to the train station, it is on a very quiet side street. Our room, no. 334 I believe, faced the train station which was nice. The station is far enough away that you don't hear anything. In fact, you're so far away that you can't get a really good look at the trains, although it is still a very nice view. All in all, this place could be alot better with a better trained staff. For gym buffs, there is a very nice gym, and also the lobby has two apple computers with free access to the internet. You have to pay for access in the rooms. Whatever you do, if you are a leisure traveller like us, make sure you go to Sacre Coeur. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable as ever”
Reviews.Author: Jeddediah
Reviews.Content: Ive stayed at two Novotels now and been impressed both times. As a base it works a treat and the pool on Paris was worth the price alone. You get many lovely little touches and the staff are superb. A good solid quiet and clean hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Even though this hotel is next to the train station we found it difficult to get into the hotel from the station.”
Reviews.Author: jollygood08
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideal for us since we arrived by train from Turin. Our confusion was around how to actually get to the hotel from the Gare de Lyon. We took a ramp that appeared to be the most direct route to the hotel, which we could see, and ended up having to take luggage down 27 steps to reach the entrance level. It is best to go out the front of the station, walk down a slope, and cross the street. Hotel staff was not helpful in telling us the better way to segue from station to hotel. Food in the cafe was AWFUL!

Reviews.Title: “far to lacking to be a 3 star - even in paris”
Reviews.Author: Houston76
Reviews.Content: Space in Paris does come at a premium but although this hotel has the space, it certainly doesnt have the service. The beds are awful, slanted and lumpy so you feel like you are sliding off, the sheets are tacky with holes in them, the pillows terrible, the bathrooms plastic from floor to wall - hospital towels and plugs which dont work, rooms only cleaned around 4pm daily, all in all a serious disappointment and I so needed some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Still good, but not great anymore”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from our second stay at the Novotel Gare de Lyon, and even if we still really liked it. It is already starting to show a lot of wear and tear. The toilet looked clean but smelled a bit of urin, I think that the layout makes it impossible to get it completely clean and the walls had some disturbing dark red spots. The bed was comfortable as the rooms can accommodate 4 people it was nice to have the extra room when only travelling 2. The breakfast was really good and I was happy to see that some organic Yogurts had found their way into the buffet. We paid 129 inclusive breakfast and found this to be excellent value for a well located hotel in Paris

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel convenient for railway station”
Reviews.Author: alanreynolds
Reviews.Content: This Novotel was similar to others of the brand we have stayed, on this trip and elsewhere. It is very close <100 metres> from eastern exit of Gare de Lyon. Look for exit 9 if you are in main station or no.11 if you are on metro platform. The main railway station, whose forecourt we could see from our hotel room 329, has a rather confusing series of long distance, regional and local services platforms. We stayed the night of Friday 26 February 2010 as seemingly did several families travelling during the school half term holidays! The hotel is modern with nice, clean design reception and bar. To use the room floors you need to swipe your room card in a slot in the lift. Our room was opposite the exercise machines' room but this was not noisy. The room had a large double bed and the convertible settee. The bathroom had a small walk-in shower as well as a bathtub. The shower was easy to understand. The toilet was separate and very small space to get in. In our room we could and did open the window; it got stuffy otherwise. As we were accompanying an African student unfamiliar with European restaurants, we decided to have both dinner and breakfast in the hotel. The dining room looks towards the station, providing interesting views for our guest. A straightforward menu which was identical in the 3 Novotel on this trip. Service was friendly but perhaps too swift as they coped with a full restaurant that night. Breakfast was also busy. Buffet style. The cut fruit was mostly tinned but the were bananas, apples, and fresh tangerines. Two types of sliced cheese, but no fish. Bread was mostly baguette. Unlike Novotel in Poland, breakfasts in French Novotel are not very imaginative. There is a narrow swimming pool but we did not use it. We paid EUR 170 for half board for the room with two people. That was ok value. We would stay again for its location and predictable facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Honor Its Pledge of 100% satisfaction garantee”
Reviews.Author: ChachoLondon
Reviews.Content: As a business arriving late at the hotel, I requested an ironing facility given an early meeting I had the next morning. It turned out to be a real issue, compounded with a very snotty staff attitude. I then wrote to customer service who replied just with few simple generic apologies. Then escalated to the hotel manager, with pictures of the poor standard facilties they had. I took him over a week to reply with just as generic apology, and despite the acknowledgement of my dissatisfaction, did not honor their pledge of 100% satisfaction or free stay. Worse part is that, getting hold of anyone at Novotel to escalate the situation, either by phone or mail is proving an even harder task. A really sub-standard chain of hotels

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family city break”
Reviews.Author: Skanks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a Eurostar break for one night and would recommend it to anyone - especially those travelling with children. We had one reasonably large room with double bed and two pull-out beds/sofa bed. The room was very clean, the staff friendly (our children were each presented with a soft toy when we checked-in - a very nice touch). The room had a free safe, mini bar, TV, and the bathroom was more than adequate. The hotel might not be the fanciest in Paris (it's a 3-star after all) but it was perfect for us. It's a little tricky to find when you get out at Gare de Lyon depending on which exit you use and the swimming pool looked a bit sad (not that we came to Paris to use the pool). Our deal did not include breakfast and we found that there were several good cafes nearby that were a little cheaper for breakfast than the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: Caustonator
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and the room smelt of paint - it brought out a horrible cold. It was the worst night's sleep I have EVER had.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected - Good But Nothing too special”
Reviews.Author: g-leinster
Reviews.Content: Spent three days in October 09 at this hotel, didnt spend much time in the hotel itself as we were too busy exploring the sites of Paris. Location Very convenient for Gare de Lyon, little bit out from the main attractions but easy to catch the metro to anywhere in city and the train to Disneyland. The area around the station while not the prettiest was fine and perfectly safe. Probably more suited to business travellers than sightseeing tourists. Check In/Out No waiting, friendly multilingual staff, helpful with a map/advice when asked. Rooms Rang the hotel and requested a smoking room and was told all the smoking rooms were on the 6th floor which suited us fine as away from any possible noise. The room itself was larger than expected, bed whilst nothing special was comfortable with plenty of pillows. All amenties you would expect TV, PPV movies & internet, safe, minibar, air con. basic bathroom and seperate toilet. Facilities/Service Restaurant, Bar, Good Size Gym and medium sized hotel pool, computers in the lobby. Didnt use much of except the restaurant for breakfast. Breakfast was a bit chaotic 1st morning and slightly better the 2nd, wouldnt recommend it unless its part of your package. Room service menu for dinner was good. quick and tasty. Overall Good, no major issues but nothing to write home about either.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: deutschinder
Reviews.Content: Great location, easy access to trains and the Seine, where one can make wonderful romantic walks up and down. Within walking distance of Gare de Austerlitz. Loads of cafes and bars all around, skip standing in line for the overpriced hotel breakfast, just walk out the main door and turn right, corner cafe serves an satisfying FRENCH Breakfast, half a baguette, croissant, coffee/tea, juice, jam and butter for 6.50 EURO p. P. Hotel looks modern, well maintained, but dismal looking swimming pool, not v. inviting. Good fitness center. But again no privacy, in Hotel balcony looks onto the center. We stayed in room 517, which looked into the station, busy road below. Keep windows closed. Not so good in summer, I can imagine. Nice bathroom but AWFUL modular sep. Toilet next to attached bathroom. SO tiny that a chubby guy will have a problem shutting the door with him/herself in it. NO FREE WIFI in the rooms, but the lobby has 2 lovely APPLE PCs and you get 20 mins free surfing. But no privacy there... so beware. They charge if you even open the mini-bar. WHich I found shocking!! So buy your drinks outside (or food snacks), hang them out of the window by jamming them against the window pane and dangling them from a plastic bag. Windows cannot be opened fully, only partially. Bed was fine, comfortable and larger than average room size, v. unusual for Paris. Comfortable flatscreen tv and nice sofa. Most prog. in French, but some international news channel. COULD BE MORE foreign language channels... AFTER ALL, NOT ALL GUESTS speak French. Good neighbourhood, not too many drunks/riff-raff on the streets. BIG PLUS: the AIRPORT CDG BUS (AF) stops in front of the station only steps away from the Hotel. Buses leave every 30 mins and cost p. P. 15 EURO,-- beats climbing up and down those awful old METRO steps if you have baggage. Same procedure when you arrive at the Gare De Lyon from the Airport The bus stop is right in front of the hotel practically. Go forward, turn right at the tunnel, up the street, max. 40 meters. AGAIN: GREAT LOCATION and GREAT CONNEX. HOTEL IS GOOD, but some basic things should be for free: WIFI and shifting the expensive MINI BAR ITEMS FOR ONE'S OWN STUFF. Reception staff speak english. Friendly on the whole and welcoming. REB 55y. MUNICH.

Reviews.Title: “a great place to stay to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: mad_scotty_dog
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in October on a short trip to Paris. The hotel was easy to find and was of the usual Novotel standard. The staff were friendly and attentive and the rooms were clean and functional but not fancy. Despite the fact there were a lot a families here, it was quiet. The hotel has a pool and gym which looked OK, but we did not use them. There is also a kids area with TV, XBoxes and some books. there were also a couple of iMacs for free internet access in the foyer. Eating in the hotel was expensive (but all of Paris is with the present exchange rate). We had breakfast in the cafe rather than the restaurant - this consisted of juice, Coffee/tea, unlimited pastries and fruit or yogurt - did us OK and was half the price of the main restaurant. We also ate in the restaurant on the first night and the food was fine. One of the main attractions of the hotel was ease of access to tour buses, metro and the train to Eurodisney - these links were great, once we managed to work out the warren of tunnels under the Gare de Lyon.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Nickat711
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and found our experience to be a good one. Great location central with trains and buses in abundance. Easy walk along the sienne to all the main attractions. Supermarkets in close range for quick eats along with wide selection of restaurants. Friendly service and rooms were clean although small. Recommended. Andy from Australia

Reviews.Title: “"did the job"”
Reviews.Author: RocknRollStar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here primarily due to the positive reviews on TA and the fact that Eurostar had a good deal on the place. The room was large enough for 2 adults and 2 children, containing one large bed and two sofa beds. Room was clean, nicely decorated as was the hotel in general. Hotel includes a kids corner which has books, an Xbox etc etc., also has a pool, which we didn't use. The hotel faces onto a square which is used by local young people to play a range of games as well as the local winos. The hotel is situated next to Gare Dy Lyon which was handy for us when we went to Disneyland as its on the same RER line as is Gare du Nord which on the RER is two stops away. Didnt try the food at the hotel, although kids eat free at the breakfast. However, there are a number of patisseries in close vicinity from which you can buy traditional french fare for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Tapyeno
Reviews.Content: This Hotel, as described in prevous reviews, is a decent, friendly place to stay. Rooms were quite adequate, all staff very friendly and breakfast was excellent, and reasonably priced - our two teenaged daughters, age 13 and 15 eat free! Near hop on hop off bus stop, and also batobus stop - about 5 min walk. We stayed three nights and have no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDawn
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Gare De Lyon Novotel and were very pleased. The rooms are huge for Paris standards, very clean and comfortable. The hotel is not right in the centre but is steps away from the yellow Metro line which takes you in minutes to the major sights. One big benefit of this hotel is the pool - travelling with young children (4 and 6), it was nice to give them some splash time (ask them which was more exciting: the Eiffel Tower or the hotel Pool and I can guarentee the answer ;-) The hotel also had a contained children's play area to one side of the lobby - parents can sit in the lobby and enjoy a cocktail while the children play away. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, but especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “More than a standard 3-star. Easy access to Disneyland.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lotus
Reviews.Content: I was apprehensive about staying at a 3-star hotel near a Parisian train station, but necessity dictated that we stay very close to Gare de Lyon. I was very pleasantly surprised. I'm familiar with the Accor group, having stayed at a few of their hotels (e.g., Sofitel), and I am now convinced they are a safe bet if you are going somewhere new and want quality assurance. The welcome at reception was friendly and check in was efficient. The lobby and common parts of the hotel were clean and tidy (seemed to be newly refurbished as well). The room was spacious and clean (don't hope for any views though). The bathroom and the separate WC were a bit odd - they made you feel like you were in the cabin of a ship (pretty small too). But very clean. Breakfast was fine. Service needs a mention. On the day we were leaving, there was no room service until 7am, but they put together a packed breakfast for us at 5 in the morning because of our early train. Only complaint is that the fitness centre (given a high profile on their website) is on the 3rd floor in an atrium which corridors above can look into. We imagined it would be pretty noisy for people staying in rooms around the atrium early in the morning and later in the evening. The equipment was good though. Overall, friendly service, clean surroundings, acceptable food. It was just what was needed. Location-wise, not as far from the interesting parts of Paris as it seems on the map. It was a short walk to the Bastille and to Place des Vosges, near which there are many nice bistros. But the area of Gare de Lyon is not somewhere I would want to hang out in general. Convenient for Disneyland Paris, as the RER train goes straight there from Gare de Lyon. I hear kids under 16 stay at the hotel for free as well.

Reviews.Title: “Handy for Gare du Lyon”
Reviews.Author: brucelambertUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed 1 night en route to the South of France. Very handy for the station the following morning and within walking distance of the Marais district which is one of our favourite districts in Paris with lots of restaurants, shops and museums. The hotel is large and functional. It is clean and quiet with a good sized room (for Paris). No complaints. Breakfast is very expensive and there are lots of places very nearby where you can have breakfast at half the price in more pleasant surroundings including in the station itslef if you are pushed for time.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jude_Starr_69
Reviews.Content: We only had one night here, but the room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was not expensive (by hotel standards) and featured a good selection of nice food. The area was a bit odd; there were a few beggars around, but as we found out they are everywhere in Paris. Very close to the train station which was great, and also there are bus stops (including for the "hop on hop off" tour bus), very close. There are some nice cafes just across the road, but if you don't want to go anywhere the hotel cafe is also a good option. Staff were extremely helpful and friendly, and there are a couple of computers for free internet access, which is always a bonus in European hotels. All in all, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: gixxerman1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest I could find with a 'fitness center'. I wouldn't call it a fitness center, but it was ok for an inner city hotel, but the pool was a large and made up for the disappointing gym facilities. Apart from that the staff where very helpful and the hotel and room were ok. The bathroom was horrible and if your a big person you may have difficulties using the toilet! It definitly wasnt worth how much I paid (220GBP a night!), but as I said, it was the cheapest I could find. I found the prices in Paris for hotels at least twice as much as London and the most expensive I have found in Northern Europe. The restaurant was ok, but you are only a short walk into the main parts of Paris and you can find much nicer cheaper food on your doorstep. If your are looking to go into tourist parts of Paris you are close to all the public transport facilities and it's also only a short walk to Notre Dame, Lourve etc. I would stay here again if I was unable to find anywhere else with the same amenities for less money.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable service at the Novotel Paris Gare de Lyon”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: The novotel Paris Gare de Lyon is not the most luxurious hotel we considered for our stay in Paris: its location is a bit eccentric to our "usual" Paris but still very central. In the end we picked it because of easy RER access to and from CDG, a pool, family rooms which can sleep 4, free bfast for kids and decent tripadvisor reviews. It is indeed very easy to and from CDG (just change at Chatelet by going to the other side of the platform). There are many nearby lovely Paris areas: la coulee verte which is a suspended garden from Bastille to les Bois de Vincennes; Bastille and its lively pedestrian streets; the sculpture garden by the Quai St. Bernard just across the bridge towards the Gare d'Austerlitz and the Bercy Park. The rooms (we moved around a bit) were spacious for Paris standards but small by american standards (I guess 250 Sq feet or so). Beds were ok (not the heavenly bed of the Westin hotels but still very decent). Coffee and minibar in room, very nice bar in the lobby, excellent bfast for the kids brought without any delay to the room by charming staff. The lobby has a great bar, a kid area for play. The best part of the hotel was the service: not a single person failed to get out of their way to make our stay special and friendly. We had active children in tow and they were more than tolerated by the hotel staff (still redirected if needed but it was all in the delivery). Definitely will consider this as a very affordable, great family option for another Paris stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and Easy”
Reviews.Author: Handy_Harry
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Novotel for a couple of nights for a sightseeing trip. You can find cheaper hotels in Paris, and certainly those with more character, but the Novotel is convenient with good facilties. It is located right next to the Gare de Lyon, so it is easy to jump on a train, or get the Metro all over the city. The Metro is the cheapest way to get around, but the least scenic. A 10 minute walk will get you to the Batobus (river bus) stop, which is a more expensive but pleasant way to get around. The rooms are typical corporate hotel - not massive, but clean with everything you need. A double bed and sofa bed worked well for the three of us. The pool (and changing rooms) are simple but functional. The pool usually had a few kids in it, but I guess that many people with children (including us) book this hotel because it has the pool. There are also some gym faciltiies which never seemed to have anyone on them. Breakfast seem expensive - 8E for a continental breakfast of 13E for a poper breakfast. However it's not much different to the local cafes, Paris is just very expensive. The continental breakfast was fine - Coffe, juice, fruit and unlimited croissants. If you can afford to gamble, save some money, look for traditional french character and stay elsewhere. If you've got kids and want peace of mind, go for the Novotel.

Reviews.Title: “Straightforward and ok”
Reviews.Author: hobozo
Reviews.Content: Travelling with family down to the south of France. This was a sensible option - great location by Gare de Lyon and near the Seine. The hotel is nothing special but nothing awful either. The service in the restaurant in the evening was poor, but the breakfast was good. The room was big enough for me, my husband and two small children (sleeping on a sofa bed). Bathroom was basic but ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: SachinSharjah
Reviews.Content: Stayed in novotel with family for 2 nights and found this hotel excellent, breakfast is superb, rooms comfortable and almost seems connected to Gare d lyon station. Very convenient to access any part of Paris. Service is friendly. Room was perfectly ready when we checked in and check in was very smooth

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, with friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: snc2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found the staff to be very helpful and welcoming. The air-conditioned room was gretaly appreciated as a welcome relief from the heat and humidity of Paris at 33 degrees celcius. The bed and the room in general were very comfortable - my only slight criticism would be that the bathroom and tolet were very basic and 'plasticy'. That being said, I would most definitely recommend a stay here. We booked via TravelRepublic and got an excellent deal.

Reviews.Title: “It made our Paris trip wonderful...”
Reviews.Author: pnewalke
Reviews.Content: We walked into the hotel less than 3 hours after we left London - it was fabulous! They immediately gave us a little stuffed animal for our 1 year old son and our room was more than ample compared to most Paris hotels. The hotel was CLEAN and the bathroom has laminate wood flooring, separate tub and shower, and separate area for the toilet. The room was large enough for a bed, sofa that pulled out into a bed, and a desk (we put our child's cot behind the desk so that he couldn't see us and would fall asleep easier). There is a grocery store just a short walk away and a FANTASTIC bakery nearby as well...I will say that the pool was cold - our son would not swim in it and I must admit, it was a bit cold for me as well. That would be my ONLY complaint. The location was perfect - we caught the open top bus not far from the hotel the first day and the second day, the weather was so lovely we walked around the entire city. It is BEAUTIFUL and the people were SO FRIENDLY and helpful (traveling with children and a pram is often difficult in London, Paris, etc. because the tube/metro are not pram friendly). It was perfect for our little family and I would definitely stay there again! We recommended it to friends who were traveling to Paris just a few months ago and have small children - and they will be recommending it to their friends because it fit their family just as well!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with Awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: Ohionotes
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel for ANYONE, but especially if you are travelling with young children. The hotel was very modern, clean, and comfortable and the rooms were large for Paris. We had a large comfortable bed and a couch that pulled out to two twin beds. The pool was nice and warm even though it wasn't really kid-friendly as there was not much of a shallow area. The staff was the BEST! We spent only one night at the hotel as we were planning on visiting Disneyland Paris but we wanted to spend one day in the city to show our youngest daughter the Paris sights. We were permitted to park our car there for the day even after we had checked out. We ran into a major problem in the city as my husband's wallet was stolen by a pick-pocket in the metro near the Eiffel tour. Even though we had already checked out of the hotel, we returned there to get our car. The front desk staff was SO HELPFUL! They allowed my husband to use their phone and helped him make many calls to our bank and credit card companies. They even called ahead to the police station to let them know that my husband would be coming in to file a report. This is a great hotel! I can't recommend it more highly!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, roomy, clean, modern, many extras”
Reviews.Author: sofa524
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel in Mid May 2009 for six nights. We were very pleased. This hotel would be good for Business, families or couples traveling. This is a modern hotel with more amenities than most Paris hotels. They include shampoo, shower gel, soap, instant coffee, tea bags, a large serving pot to heat water, in-room safe, hairdryer, TV, free internet in the lobby and more. There is an exercise room and indoor heated pool. The pool has separate men’s and women’s entrances. Each has lockers, towels, and its own bathroom with a shower. The hotel is in a great location. It is next to a large train station that can get you anywhere. You cannot hear the trains at all. This is a safe neighborhood. We were walking around at 10 pm with no worries. There are many restaurants in the area especially across from the steps to the train station. The hotel front desk staff is very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. They speak fluent English and other languages as well. Have them give you a map of Paris with the attractions. The map is helpful and can give you ideas of what to visit. They don’t have a converter for all countries electricty. Buy and bring your own if you are coming from the USA or Canada so that you can charge your camera batteries and other items. The hotel has 3 types of rooms: Superior, Executive and Suites. The Superior rooms are Full size bed, Full size with sofa bed, Queen size bed or Queen size bed with a sofa bed. All these are the same price so ask for the Queen size with sofa. I didn’t see an Executive or Suite room. We had a Superior room that had the Queen bed and sofa. It was nice, roomy and had a comfortable bed. The bathroom had both a bathtub and shower. The toilet is in a separate spot. The hotel has a cafe and a restaurant. Both are expensive. The regular breakfast is 8 Euros for just a Croissant, cup of coffee and glass of juice. The full breakfast is 16 euros. Many local restaurants are open for breakfast and much cheaper. Here is what we did. Go out the front door and walk straight down the street (with train station to the left). When you get to the corner there is a Patissiere/Bakery straight ahead. Just cross the crazy intersection. We would get ready in the morning, put on a pot of water to heat, and go get breakfast at the Bakery. Croissants are less than 1 euro, and quiche is 1.95 euros, other bakery items are not expensive. They heated and then wrapped up the quiche. We took our food back to the hotel, made coffee or tea and ate our quiche (still warm). They also sell sandwiches and bakery items cheaper than anyone else. All items were delicious. To get to the metro go out the front door and turn right. Go to the corner and turn left. Just ahead is the closest metro stop. The actual train station has many levels and can get you to other metro routes and trains. You can get to the train station easiest from the hotel back entrance. At the train station we bought the 5 day, 3 zone Metro pass. This will get you to all the popular Paris attractions. They can also give you a metro map. You can buy a one day pass to zone 4 to get to Versailles, or another zone to go to EuroDisney. If you go to Versailles on Sat or Sunday you now have to pay an extra fee to go into the gardens because they turn on the fountains twice a day on weekends. It was not worth the 8 euros to see the fountains spray water, I recommend going on a weekday. We did go up to St. Dennis Basilique (still in zone 3). Beautiful church with many kings and queens buried there. Also not crowded. We bought the museum pass. It was not worth what they charged for it so I would not buy it again. It didn’t include many museums that we came across and we still had to stand in line in most places. You should note that Paris restaurants include the tip. It is included even if not shown on the receipt. Be careful that you don’t add on another tip.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: leong1234
Reviews.Content: The is a modern efficient business style hotel. Surprisingly, it should also work out well for family with kids. The room is clean and very spacious for Paris particularly if you get one of the queen bedroom with a pull out couch for another 2 people. We got one of those (510) for the same price as a regular room. So, if you are tired of getting one of those ‘charming’, tiny, old broom closets that called itself a hotel room, this is a welcome change. I would imagine this to be a great deal if you are traveling with kids, which is not our case. The bathroom is interesting. It has separate bathtub and shower stall. The toilet is in a separate adjacent room the size of an airline toilet. The whole setup is a pre-fab, efficiency module plunk down into a corner of the room much like those you find in crusie ships. The swimming pool, while not large, is decent and unexpected for a city establishment. It is opened 24 hours. Given the hotel is right next to a major rail station, the environment is a bit down market. Not really an issue if you use the place as a base for sight seeing using the metro. Getting to metro is interesting. As previous posters have mentioned, if you got yourself into Gare de Lyon station itself, it is a huge maze with long walks and not easy to find directions. However, Metro line 1 is really very close (less than 5 mintues) if you know the way. (a) Face the reception desk at the lobby, (b) Exit to hotel on the right of the recption desk (c) Walk straight out into the small street and to the main street (d) turn right at the main street and you should see the red Metro sign a few meters ahead of the Chinese restaurant (which is actually not bad at all). The train track is just down the stair case. Basically, the metro is less than 5 minutes from the hotel – if you do not go into Gare de Lyon. Coming home, take exit 10 or 11 from the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean and good service”
Reviews.Author: TerryH12
Reviews.Content: I was having a quick stopover in Paris on the way home from 3 weeks in Italy with my wife and 15 yo son, so we needed a hotel near the station and centrally located in Paris. Reviews of the smaller boutique type hotels near the station looked very dodgy so we opted for the slightly higher priced but reputable Novotel. I was not disappointed. The location was excellent for both international train connections and the Metro. The room and bathroom were clean, well appointed and comfortable, if not a little cramped. To be honest, we did have our teenage son with us and he takes up a bit of space. The bed was large and among the most comfortable we had in our travels. I would recommend the hotel as consistent, high quality Novotel service and would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms and Indoor Pool. Be careful of nearby Restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: UkSki
Reviews.Content: The rooms were really nice with a double and a sofa. The sofa folded out to 2 single beds which was great for the children. It cost me €195 in total for 2 rooms which sounds expensive but I had a good look around and it was definately the best value as alot of ibis and some etap hotels will only take 2 per room and staying this close to the centre of paris, you would expect to pay a similar price in a tiny 2 star hotel. There is also free internet in the foyer. The hotel pool was open 24 hours which I thought was fantastic. We used it when we came back from dinner at midnight and it is perfect if you want to relax after arriving on an evening flight. Don't worry about noise. The pool is below the foyer and isn't near any of the rooms and we heard no noise at all. The gym was still open at 10pm but was closed when we came back from dinner. Be careful about eating in restaurants near the Gare de Lyon. Prices are very high to take advantage of those coming form the Air France CDG shuttle bus and the TGV trains. At one restaurant we sat down and were told that unless we were ordered 4 pizzas we would not be allowed to eat there. We could not believe it and went to a great all night takeaway/ pizza shop. Prices were very reasonable, they were very fiendly and they were proper pizzas. You can sit outside as well! As you leave the hotel go straight ahead and when you get to where all the motorcycles are parked turn right onto boulevard dideroit. If you want to eat at a restaurant I would recomment taking a metro two stops east on the metro line 1 which is a nice area with alot more restaurants. There are also fast food shops like McDonalds and Quick. There is a velib station near the hotel and I would recommend using this if you want to hire bikes in Paris. It's great but be aware that you will have to pay a €150 deposit which will take 5 days to go back to your bank account. The only negative about the hotel is that in contry to what one of the previous guests said, it is unlikely that you will see the TGVs from your room. We asked for a room with a view of the trains and the receptionist was very helpful but understandably because of the curved shape of the building there are only 4 rooms on each floor which would definately have a view of the trains. From memory these were 28, 30, 32, 34 and maybe 26 but check the floor plan and request one of these. We could still see the trains though a window at the end of the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Aussie71
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was easy to find, just next to the train station . I caught the Air France 4 shuttle from the airport which stops right in front of the train station. There are a few cafes across the road, 2 small supermarkets nearby and a bus stop for the Open Top tourist bus. Its probably not the most exciting area to stay in Paris, but the price was reasonable and the front desk staff were quite professional. My room (341) was good sized and smelt very fresh and clean. There is an automatic mini-bar. If you remove a drink you are charged for it. This happened to me, but when I explained that I was using the fridge for my own drinks the charge was removed with no fuss. The Hotel was quiet and close by to the Seine, which you can walk along to get to the Notre Dame Cathedral. The staff at the breakfast buffet kept clearing my table before I had left and yet didnt notice a small child who was touching everything, dropping things from the buffet on the floor and then putting them back on the table. It would probably be better to get breakfast from across the road. There is also a small range of snack food available to buy in the lobby, including potato crisps, drinks etc with nice paper bags to use if you want to grab something on the run.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jenan2000
Reviews.Content: I had a one week training in Paris and was booked in this hotel by the company. I was not happy at first because I prefer staying in a hotel in the middle of the attractions. However, I was very pleased as soon as I entered my room. It was very clean, modern and spacious with a very comfortable bed and a sofa bed. The bathroom was ok with a separate toilet. I think it will be better if they were all together in a bigger bathroom instead of having two small ones. The location is ideal. Next door to Gare de Lyon which is a big train station ( metro, domestic and international trains). The staff are very helpful. There are two computers in the lobby with free internet. Many cafes and restaurants are found nearby and also a supermarket. If I go in a businss trip again I will stay here for sure, but if I travel with my family I prefer to stay in the middle of the action. In general, this hotel is for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: sienaDevon
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at this hotel and loved it. Our children (4 and 6) were given a soft toy on arrival which made their day and when we returned from our day out on Valentine's Day there was a rose in the room. Little touches, but welcome. Very quiet room, overlooking the TGV trains at the Gare de Lyon - my little boy loved this. We also appreciated the hotel pool - a bit chilly but still a bonus in a Parisian hotel. There was also a little kids area in the lobby area - we managed to read a newspaper whilst the kids played there with some other children they made friends with. Room big enough and clean. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful & friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsmac
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean, comfortable hotel with very professional, exceptionally friendly & helpful staff. It was really quiet at night (unusual in Paris) & the room was quite spacious, with a nice bathroom (bath tub & separate walk in shower) and your own temperature control for the heating. Buses & metro just outside give easy access to central Paris. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcus-St
Reviews.Content: We had a nice 3 night stay here. Check-in was quick and easy with our son (5) given a soft toy by reception which he was very pleased with. Our room (205) was a reasonable size in good condition and very clean. Space was a bit limited when we folded out the sofa bed at night for our son to sleep on, but it was not a big issue. Both beds very very confortable. The only issue we had was that our room was very hot. We tried having the air-con on as low as it would go which didn't do much, opened the window (plenty of traffic noise as there is a busy underpass nearby) but that made no difference. We wondered if the heat was coming up from the swimming pool which was below our room. Breakfast was not included in our room rate, so we planned to go out to eat, but ended up everyday eating in (15euro per adult, children free). It gets very busy at breakfast service, but once you are given a table it is fine and the buffet is very good. Cheaper breakfast can be had at the bar for 8 euro, but is very limited. The pool is fine, with very limited changing space. The surrounding areas is perhaps not one of the nicest areas of Paris, but very good for the station and ongoing connections. There were a number of places to eat not far from the hotel and a good couple of supermarkets to stock up on snacks/drinks fro the room to avoid paying the usual horrific mini-bar prices. I would be happy to stay there again, if I knew my room would not be soooo hot.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in a handy location”
Reviews.Author: swinesheadvillage
Reviews.Content: Credit to the Accor chain, Novotel Gare de Lyon has a load of options on price, and can be therefore very reasonable for a central Paris hotel. Seemingly big, its still quiet and nothing at all wrong with the rooms. Manager should win French version of the Apprentice as staff are excellent, and amazingly for Paris unfailingly courteous. I've given it a five because for a big, cheap hotel in the middle of Paris it would struggle to improve. Would not hesitate to recomend in a heartbeat this one. V V Good.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bennettsontour
Reviews.Content: My family and I only have praise for this excellent 3 star hotel. I have stayed in many Novotels with mixed experiences but this one has all the facilities of a 4 star (well apart from the capsule bathroom and toilet) with the customer service of a 5 star. We stayed for four nights with a little child and although a slight walk into the central tourist attractions were pleased to return every night to the comfort of our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hecol
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our stay at the Novotel - we found it relaxing, comfortable and ideally located. The hotel is really clean and the room was spacious and bright. Very soundproofed. The indoor pool was very warm although there is not much shallow water for kids. Breakfast was extensive and provided everything you need. Staff were friendly and all spoke good English although they appreciated our attempts at French! We found the food in the hotel to be expensive but this is not a problem as there are so many restaurants and take aways near by that there is a wide variety of choice. There is a small, well stocked supermarket accross the square with a very friendly French chap. Also accross the square is a sandwich bar which do very tasty sandwiches etc and it's really cheap. We have 2 very young kids and I was delighted to find that Dolce Vita in the road accross from the hotel do good take away pasta dishes which fed our kids throughout our break. I didn't find that shady characters are a problem at all. There are some strange looking folks who you wouldn't want to make eye contact with but no more than in any other part of Paris really. It's a city - you're going to get all sorts. Metro line 1 is a few steps from the side door. (right of reception desk if you look at reception head on). Don't try and find metro line 1 through the main entrance to Gare Du Lyon. The station is massive and the signage leaves alot to be desired and I guarantee you will get lost! When you first arrive at the station you must exit through exit 9 otherwise you're stuffed! If you're coming from CDG airport, you can take airport schuttle untill Gare de Lyon station, or take rer D until Chatellet les Halles or Gare Du Nord, and change to take rer B to stop at Gare de Lyon station. Basically you want RER D from CDG and then swap to B for Gare Du Lyon. The metro and trains are very pushchair unfriendly - be prepared to collapse your pushchair regularly and lift it up and down stairs! You'll be very fit by the end of it. It's fine if there are 2 of you but travel light!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our choice”
Reviews.Author: 4venture
Reviews.Content: Arrived very late after a delayed flight, the hotel staff were very helpful and our room was perfect. We booked in Jan 08 and requested a spacious room, which is what we got. Our room, 555, was nearly twice the size of the standard room. We were staying for 7 nights so appreciated the extra space for no extra cost. There are some homeless people about however they never caused us any bother, they make you appreciate what you have got. Didn't bother with hotel breakfast since there were supermarkets close by. Travelled with our two kids (6 & 9) who adored Paris. Would recommend the Rough Guide to Paris guide book. Pool, air con and late checkout added to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “We ARe Going Back To The Ibis!”
Reviews.Author: Shejohn
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Paris and usually stay at the Bastille Ibis (same group as Novotel) or the Bastille Citadines (subject to who has the availability). This time because of a late arrival and a long journey we thought we would go for the Novotel for little added comfort and the pool. Checking in was a nightmare, we were handed in electronic key after electronic key, but it was almost impossible for reception staff to find one that worked. Eventually after some pleading a member of staff came up with us and conceded that there was a problem. We were then allocated a different room, once again the electronic key would not work and arrival to getting in the room took almost an hour in the end. Once in the room was fine but our humour had become somewhat diluted. Drinks and beggars surround the hotel area and there was lots of shouting in the night from outside. We will go back to Paris (we always will!) but next time, it’s back to the Ibis, smaller room, more basic but we will enjoy the quiet, the location and the relative calm. Au revoir Novotel! Bonjour Ibis we have missed you!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: CapeBob05
Reviews.Content: For a family of 4 it was adequate. Reasonably priced, location at a train and metro station. Neighborhood can be a pretty seedy at night time. Staff was very helpful, minimal workout facilities. Breakfast was ok, not sure worth the 15 euros per adult.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal For families”
Reviews.Author: EuropeanTourist201
Reviews.Content: It would be hard to find a better deal if you are travelling with young children. We paid € 109/night for a room with breakfast where two kids under the age of 16 were free. On top of it, subject to availability, we could check in as early as 1000 hrs and check out as late as 1600 hrs. As we had an onward flight at 2100 hrs, they allowed us even late check-out - we cleared our room at 1800 hrs. Really great, I must admit. In other words, for the price of 2 nights we could have 3 nice days in Paris. Or put it simply, value for money in true sense. Breakfast was above average, taking the room price in account. Location was perfect, merely few steps to Gare de Lyon train station and a few minutes walk to the RER/Metro trains - almost all major tourist attractions easily assessable in 10-15 minutes. The only objection I have is that charging for internet access is a big No-No nowadays. Free for accompanying young kids

Reviews.Title: “Smart and spacious”
Reviews.Author: barneybear66
Reviews.Content: Novotel is a brand which should deliver given the price bracket and the fact that primarily it is aimed at the discerning (?) business traveller. In the case of this recently built Novotel located two steps from Gare de Lyon station (perhaps four steps until you have worked out the exit from the station which leads to the hotel's 'back' door), after spending two nights there for my money the brand delivers 100%. The check-in was efficient, the staff eager to please and the paperwork was all over in a couple of minutes. The room numbering system in the hotel is a bit frustrating (room 321 is nowhere near room 320 for example) but once in the room all is forgiven. Large and airy, our room had a sofa, mini-bar and view out on the square behind the hotel (beware two sides of the hotel have views of nothing but one does look out onto a large open space with lots of people watching opportunitiies). Despite the proximity of the station, we didn't find noise to be an issue thanks to good double glazing; internal sound proofing is good. The main breakfast is before 9.30 during the week (10.30 at weekends) and is a good mix of continental and cooked items but there are other options in-house from 4.30am to midday. The pool is small and narrow so don't expect much but there is one which for a Parisian hotel at this price range is very rare; the small gym has some useful machines is located, rather bizarely, in an open space which can be viewed from above by all floors (so working that body is not for the self conscious!). The location is incredibly handy for public transport thanks to the Gare de Lyon being on the doorstep. It is also an easy walk to Bastille using the Plants Walkway located on the former railway line (look for the railway arches and find stairs up) for a wide variety of bars and restaurants. Also, use the metro to visit Bercy (don't bother walking there) and explore the small shops and eating opportunities in this up and coming area. Finally, try and experience the champagne cruise from Eiffel Tower run by o-chateau.com - just magical. Overall, we paid about £100 a night on an early booking deal (incl breakfast) and it felt very good value for money given our experience; we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, relatively nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: grace_k_m
Reviews.Content: This hotel is walking distance from the train station and the metro. The staff at the reception were friendly and the rooms were of a decent size. It was clean and the bathroom was very well-mantained. The selection of TV channels was ample. Overall, it was a satisfactory stay.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelchickAustralia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for its proximity to Gare deLyon train station ie a few minutes walk to the RER/Metro trains, so you can be in the middle of Paris in under 10 minutes. There were a couple of local supermarkets nearby within a 10minute walk, so it was good to get some supplies. The train station itself was great for lunch, with lots of baguettes, pastries, drinks available. The hotel and rooms are very modern, bed was huge and comfortable, water pressure excellent in shower. My main disappointment is the level of noise that could be heard eg every door that closed (slammed shut) around us could easily be heard. At one point early in the morning I wondered what a particular noise was behind my pillows thru the wall - I then realised someone was stirring their coffee vigorously with their spoon in the room next door. For a 4 star hotel I guess I expected to be a little bit 'cocooned' from noise. We were far down a corridor so we at least did not have to put up with any nearby lifts (that would 'ding' each time reaching a floor). The restaurant was quite pricey and although we tried to entertain the waiting staff with our limited French, there was a lot that was lost in translation - however the Front Desk lobby staff were always more than helpful, had excellent English and more than happy to assist with our touristy questions.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic family hotel”
Reviews.Author: RAECambridge_UK
Reviews.Content: Having read other reviews on this site, we decided to book this hotel for the swimming pool, as we have children aged 8 and 9 (if weather was miserable we would occupy them and if it was hot, we could cool off!) This was a great choice! Apart from the pool, which is narrow but quite long - you can actually swim whilst the children play - there is also a games area with table football and a play station. The children were happy! But as the bar is very close to the games room - we were very happy too! Rooms were not large, but had separate loo to the bathroom and very comfy beds. Breakfast was good, as long as you left yourself time to eat it - they started clearing up bang on time! The hotel is very easy to find - metro line 1- and within easy access to everything in Paris. We actually walked to the Eiffel Tower from the hotel, but the Metro is easy to use as is the Open Top Bus. (Buy the 2 day ticket as it is only 3 euros more!) We did all the major sites in 3 days and would recommend Paris as a city to visit with children and the hotel is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worst vacation hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: bk2tnns1
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a department store in Paris where my girlfriend and I bought two new pillows for the bed. It's been three nights and we've yet to have a good night's sleep. The bed is TERRIBLE. The mattress is literally 6 inches thick (foam) and rock hard. The pillows feel like they're stuffed with cotton balls. Lumpy and hard. When we checked in I asked to look at some other rooms as well but they all had the same problem, including the suites. The decor is also drab. I'm not deducting points for this, since it's more of a business traveler hotel, but if you're looking for Parisian charm, steer clear.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good-sized rooms but definitely avoid in summer - far too hot and stuffy!”
Reviews.Author: Shokan77
Reviews.Content: This was a good option. Decently located in the 12th near Gare de Lyon. Its not the prettiest or chicest area of Paris but it is quite safe and its a reasonably short walk to Bastille and Le Marais. We also walked to the Eiffel Tower and Champs Elysees from the hotel although its a 5K walk and not everyone will be up for that! The rooms were quite large for Paris and staff were courteous and helpful. The hotel was very clean. Only frustrating thing was the lack of air-con. We had hot, still weather (25 degrees) that weekend which made for a somewhat uncomfortable sleep. I would definitely avoid it in summer as the rooms would become unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Traveller43Essex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in a family room for 2 adults and 2 children. The room was clean and comfortable and a decent size for Paris. Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful and the indoor pool and children's play area went down well with the younger family members. The area around the hotel was what you'd expect for somewhere close to a large railway station but we found some good value restaurants and cafes nearby. The hotel is very close to the station so ideally situated for the Metro and RER as well as other trains. Overall, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Hot and bothered!!!”
Reviews.Author: Clint_Swagger
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this hotel. I really wished I'd read my last review in more detail as I had forgotten just how warm and stuffy the rooms in this hotel are. In fact the whole hotel is like it! I think I got lulled into a false sense of security because we (as a family) stayed in 3 different Novotels last year and generally had a good experience in all three. The rooms are clean, the locations are generally very good and the breakfasts are excellent. This time however, the warmth and general stuffiness of the room was almost unbearable. We happen to have a clock with a thermometer and it was reading between 25 degrees and 26 degrees the whole time we were there (it was 8 degrees outside). The climate control is actually a fan (nope its not air-conditioning, its a fan which sounds like air con, but does next to nothing to reduce the temperature of your room when running at full speed). We slept with the window open which wasn't quiet but at least we had a trickle of fresh air circulating. Now it may be we were unlucky with the rooms again but having spoken to a number of other guests, they complained of the same thing. When we actually complained to the staff, they were less than interested. Admittedly there was little they could do but their attitude was frankly Parisien! My advice is if you are planning to stay here, take a fan with you. It will make the stay all together more pleasant. My advice to Novotel is either install Air-Con (I'm sorry but there really is no excuse not to have it) or provide ceiling or desktop fans. Oh yes and on the last morning, we queued for 15 mins for breakfast. There were alot of families staying in the hotel...maybe someone should have realised. They all looked hot and bothered as well!!!
